article_title: Michael J Foxâ€™s heartbreaking health confession
article_text: Michael J Fox has made a heartbreaking confession about his long battle with Parkinsonâ€™s disease, and revealed a shocking health scare he had previously kept secret. The beloved Hollywood actor was diagnosed with Parkinsonâ€™s disease when he was 29 years old in 1991, and went public with his diagnosis in 1998.Now 62, Fox has opened up about his health and shared that it â€œwouldnâ€™t be unheard ofâ€ if he were to lose his battle with the disease in the near future. Michael J. Fox has shared some frank confessions about his battle with Parkinsons. Picture by Bryan Bedder/Getty Images for ReedPop.â€œOne day Iâ€™ll run out of gas,â€ he told Town & Country. â€œOne day Iâ€™ll just say, â€˜Itâ€™s not going to happen. Iâ€™m not going out today.â€™ If that comes, Iâ€™ll allow myself that. Iâ€™m 62 years old. Certainly, if I were to pass away tomorrow, it would be premature, but it wouldnâ€™t be unheard of. And so, no, I donâ€™t fear that.â€Fox has battled numerous health problems over the last decade.In 2018, he underwent surgery after doctors discovered he had a tumour near his spine. At the time, he was told he may never walk again. However, after several months of rehabilitation he learned to walk again only to end up breaking his arm months later. Since then, Fox has had several further injuries, including battling an infection in his hand and â€œalmost losing itâ€ as a result.â€œMy hand got infected and then I almost lost it,â€ he revealed. â€œIt was a tsunami of misfortune.â€Fox has confessed that his time could come sooner than he would like it to. Picture by Matt Winkelmeyer/Getty Images.More CoverageHollywood star posts rare pic of lookalike sonInsult that made Michael J. Fox fall for wifeEarlier this year, in an interview with CBS Sunday Morning, the actor said that falling â€œis a big killer with Parkinsonâ€™s. Falling and aspirating food and getting pneumonia â€” all these subtle ways that get you. He went on to admit that he doesnâ€™t seem himself still being alive for another two decades, despite his will to survive.â€œYou donâ€™t die from Parkinsonâ€™s; you die with Parkinsonâ€™s,â€ added the iconic star. â€œSo Iâ€™ve been thinking of the mortality of it. Iâ€™m not going to be 80. Iâ€™m not going to 80.â€

caption: An Aussie wife has confessed that she â€œcanâ€™t stop picking fightsâ€ with her husband and the reason is incredibly sad.
article_title: â€˜I criticise my husband every day and I donâ€™t know whyâ€™
article_text: Welcome to Relationship Rehab, news.com.auâ€™s weekly column solving all your romantic problems, no holds barred.This week, our resident sexologist Isiah McKimmie helps a woman who wants to stop nagging her â€œplacidâ€ husband.QUESTION: I really love my husband but I canâ€™t stop picking fights with him. Iâ€™m not sure why I behave this way but I criticise him a lot over everything from how he dresses to the fact he doesnâ€™t do enough around the house. Heâ€™s a very placid man and the more I nag him, the quieter he gets. I begin each day promising myself that I will pick at him less but then before I know what Iâ€™m saying a scathing remark about him is coming out of my mouth. Why am I behaving this way toward him and how can I stop?ANSWER: Itâ€™s hard to acknowledge where weâ€™re messing up in our relationships. I appreciate your awareness and acknowledgment of your actions here.There are always good reasons we act the way we do. It isnâ€™t because youâ€™re a terrible person. We need to understand whatâ€™s driving your actions and then give you tools for change to prevent this permanently damaging your relationship.I really love my husband but I canâ€™t stop picking fights with him. Picture: iStockCriticism will damage your relationshipCriticism is one of four common communication styles, known as â€˜The Four Horsemenâ€™ that predict the end of a relationship. Criticism will always damage your relationship, even if you donâ€™t intend it to.My concern is that your husband isnâ€™t just placid. Itâ€™s that heâ€™s actually conflict avoidant. While it might seem like heâ€™s just becoming quieter, my fear is that heâ€™s actually building resentment and distance with every sharp remark.Avoiding criticising your husband doesnâ€™t mean that you never share your concerns with him. There are ways you can learn to share that will make it easier for him to hear and that wonâ€™t damage the relationship.Changing your communication to avoid criticism will take some effort, self awareness and practice. Instead of picking at your partner, youâ€™ll need to learn to slow down, connect to your emotions and then speak differently.My concern is that your husband isnâ€™t just placid. Itâ€™s that heâ€™s actually conflict avoidant. Picture: iStockOur actions are driven by emotions While it would be easy for me to tell you to change your communication, thatâ€™s almost impossible without a deeper understanding of whatâ€™s going on emotionally for you.We are emotionally driven beings â€“ even those of us who consider ourselves â€˜logicalâ€™. Most of the time, our emotions are unconscious. We spring to action before weâ€™ve really had a chance to notice which emotions are driving our actions. When we gain awareness of our emotions, we also gain control of them. Go slowly for more understandingFor us to understand the emotions that are unconsciously driving our actions, we need to go slowly. Imagine yourself back in one of those moments right before you pick at or criticise your husband. What do you notice happens in your body? Our body is the doorway in which to begin to feel and name our emotions.What emotion goes with that? Go slowly. We often feel what are known as â€˜secondary emotionsâ€™ first. These are less vulnerable emotions like anger or frustration that protect us from the harder to feel emotions like sadness, fear and shame.There are emotions inside of you that are driving you acting out. It might be how you feel about yourself, how youâ€™re feeling in your relationship or something you feel about your partner.My educated guess is that there is some kind of fear here. I guess that there is some kind of fear here. Perhaps fear that he isnâ€™t really there for you. Picture: iStockPerhaps fear about what your partner is doing. Perhaps fear that he isnâ€™t really there for you. Research shows that when women feel disconnected to their partners throughout the day, theyâ€™re more likely to share their concerns in a harsh way when they reconnect in the evenings. With this deeper awareness, you can then change how youâ€™re communicating. This is the premise of really effective couples therapy.The â€˜antidoteâ€™ to criticismOnce you know what your emotions are, you can then use the â€˜antidote to criticismâ€™ when youâ€™re communicating.The antidote to criticism has three steps:I feel â€¦About what â€¦More CoverageWife rages about common husband problemBig problem â€˜many menâ€™ have with wifeI need â€¦First, share your underlying emotion with your husband. Then tell him what itâ€™s in relation to. Then tell him how he can be your hero, what you need him to do.Again, this takes practice, but it can make an enormous difference to your relationship in the long term.

caption: â€œIf Iâ€™m spending $20, Iâ€™m going to a better place than McDonaldâ€™s.â€ ðŸ˜¬
article_title: â€˜Crazyâ€™ McDonaldâ€™s prices slammed after â€˜menu increasesâ€™ confirmed
article_text: McDonaldâ€™s customers are lashing out after the fast-food giant recorded a huge revenue spike, which the burger chain credited to â€œstrategic menu price increasesâ€.The global food company, which has 1032 restaurants in Australia and more than 40,000 worldwide, recently announced its US revenue was up 14 per cent in the latest quarter, bringing in a total of $US6.69 billion for the three-month period ending September 30.During an earnings call with investors, McDonaldâ€™s CFO Ian Borden confirmed the companyâ€™s US prices had increased in the third quarter, The New York Post reports.Though he didnâ€™t specify by how much, Mr Borden said McDonaldâ€™s expects to increase the cost of its menu items by just over 10 per cent for the full year â€” the second consecutive annual 10 per cent price hike.McDonaldâ€™s has confirmed higher than expected profits in the US, crediting â€˜strategic menu price increasesâ€™. Picture: TikTokIn Australia, McDonaldâ€™s has also admitted increasing prices, after Aussies claimed â€œMaccaâ€™s is way more expensiveâ€ than it had ever been previously. â€œLike all businesses we are operating in a higher-cost environment, which does impact the cost of running great restaurants in communities across Australia,â€ a spokesperson told news.com.au in June.â€œWe will always work hard to provide our customers with great value.â€ However the latest price hike admission has left Maccaâ€™s fans around the world furious, with many taking to social media to express their anger. One fast-food diner from Connecticut recently shared their shock at discovering a Big Mac meal now costs $US18 ($A27.65) at his local Maccaâ€™s.â€œThese McDonaldâ€™s prices are nuts right???â€ a post by Sam Learner on X, formerly known as Twitter, read.A photo of the menu appeared alongside it, showing various burgers at the shock price. â€˜These McDonaldâ€™s prices are nuts right?â€™. Picture: Sam Learner/XAnother burger fan revealed theyâ€™d paid $US16 ($A24.60) for a â€œhappy mealâ€.â€œSo, I understand thereâ€™s a labour shortage, wage increases, and a number of other factors, but $16? $16 for a burger, a large fry, and a drink? Itâ€™s just crazy,â€ Christopher Olive, an influencer with more than 400,000 followers, shared in a TikTok video. In the clip, he shows the receipt for his purchase, proving how much his order cost. Both posts have garnered a huge reaction, with customers expressing their disappointment at the rising prices, suggesting the burger giant is no longer affordable for many.â€œI remember when a big Mac meal was $2.99 Iâ€™m that old,â€ one remarked. â€œIf Iâ€™m spending $20, Iâ€™m going to a better place than McDonaldâ€™s,â€ another agreed. As one declared: â€œItâ€™s officially not convenient or affordable anymore.â€ Christopher Olive paid $US16 ($A24.60) for a â€˜happy mealâ€™, labelling it â€˜crazyâ€™. Picture: TikTok/Christopher OliveLocally there have been similar gripes from Australians, though itâ€™s worth noting, it is hard to compare prices efficiently due to the fact each McDonaldâ€™s is a franchise, meaning individual owners all charge slightly differently for the same food items.More CoverageFury at womanâ€™s â€˜irritatingâ€™ Maccaâ€™s orderFury as Maccaâ€™s scraps popular menu itemâ€œItâ€™s insane, Maccaâ€™s is more expensive than sit down restaurants for the same quantity of food,â€ one Aussie lamented on Reddit recently.â€œA cheeseburger cost me $5 today, but I remember when they were only three bucks,â€ another commented.McDonaldâ€™s Australia hasnâ€™t released its annual sales figures for 2023 yet, but reported a record high of $2bn last year.Read related topics:TikTok

caption: It was actually a secret signal. ðŸ‘€ Full story: https://bit.ly/49lr9W1
article_title: Matt Preston reveals the secret hand gesture he used to make on TV
article_text: Matt Preston has revealed the truth about a â€œsecret hand gestureâ€ heâ€™d make while filming MasterChef.Speaking to news.com.au to promote his new memoir, Big Mouth (due out November 7), Preston said he came up with the on-screen gesture to let his wife, Emma, know that he was thinking of her.â€œThe first four years of MasterChef were shot in Sydney and my family lived in Melbourne,â€ the food critic explained.â€œSo I had to find ways when she was watching the show, of letting her know that she was there (in his mind).â€œAt that point, I used to wear two wedding rings on my left hand, so during tastings I would twist the ring on my finger â€¦ so that she could watch and know that I wasnâ€™t just lost in some strange MasterChef celebrity bubble but I was actually remembering her.â€Matt Preston making his 'secret hand gesture'.Matt and his family in 2013.Tension with Gary MehiganIn Big Mouth, Preston also reveals that things were â€œa little frostyâ€ between himself and fellow judge Gary Mehigan in season one of MasterChef in 2009.â€œYou have to understand that there is a fundamental cobra versus mongoose relationship between food critics and restaurateurs,â€ the cravat-loving star told news.com.au, adding that perhaps Mehigan wasnâ€™t thrilled with a review he had written about one of his restaurants in the past.â€œIâ€™m the guy who came to Garyâ€™s restaurant, The Boathouse, and had a wobbly table and wrote about how wobbly my table was. He wasnâ€™t happy.â€œSo there was a certain amount of professional suspicion, shall we say,â€ he laughed.Preston said the pair quickly sorted out their issues and he now considers Mehigan to be â€œone of my most trusted friendsâ€.Former MasterChef judges Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan. Picture: Peter WallisHounded by papsThe first few seasons of MasterChef made the three judges, Matt, Gary and George, household names in Australia.It also meant they were followed by photographers wherever they went.â€œI was told that a â€˜damagingâ€™ picture, you know, Matt Preston feeding his kindergarten age daughter junk food, was worth about $40,000, so you can understand why photographers were out there,â€ Preston told news.com.au.In Big Mouth, Preston shares a particularly amusing paparazzi-related story about his Channel 10 co-star, George.â€œGeorge thought he was being hounded because there was a photographer basically camped outside his house in Bondi,â€ he said.George was so annoyed by the papâ€™s presence that he decided to move out of the property.â€œHe was like, â€˜thatâ€™s it, Iâ€™ve got to leave, I canâ€™t be in Bondi anymore, thereâ€™s too many papsâ€™,â€ Preston recalled.As George was in the process of moving he out, he confronted the photographer.â€œHe was like, â€˜Iâ€™m going!â€™ and (the photographer) said, â€˜who are you?â€™â€ Preston laughed.It turns out the pap was actually camped out on the street to take photos of Lara Bingle who lived a few doors down.Matt with George in 2009.Matt Prestonâ€™s new book.MasterChef secrets revealedPreston shares some behind the scenes secrets about MasterChef in his memoir, Big Mouth.For example, he answers a question that gets asked on social media every season by viewers watching at home: â€œDonâ€™t the dishes go cold before the judges have a chance to taste them?â€â€œWe had a number of strategies to ensure that we could see the food in its best form,â€ Preston told news.com.au.One of the strategies was to get the contestants to make a second dish once the challenge had ended.â€œWeâ€™d taste that in a speed tasting before we did the main tasting,â€ Preston said. â€œWe would go around and look at things like how high the souffle had risen and were the chips crispy.â€The former MasterChef judges doing their thing.The former judge said theyâ€™d also taste the dishes as they were being made by the contestants.â€œWe were wandering around the whole time, you could see us in the back of each shot, poking into pots and tasting,â€ he said.â€œAll youâ€™re trying to do is make the playing field for the contestants as even as possible.â€Big MouthIn his memoir, Preston also writes about his adoption, his fractured childhood, some shocking family tragedies, his disastrous spell in the British Army and his burgeoning journalistic career in 1980s London. It will be released on November 7.

caption:
The Bulldogs player was the biggest draw at Flemington.
Via news.com.au Sport
article_title: Western Bulldogs star Bailey Smith goes public with Gemma Dawkins
article_text: Bailey Smith stole the limelight on Derby Day as he stepped out for his Birdcage debut.The Western Bulldogs star, who has become the most followed player in the AFL on social media, broke hearts as he went public with his partner Gemma Dawkins.Watch the Melbourne Cup LIVE with RACING.COM on Kayo Sports. Join now and start streaming instantly >As a guest of G.H Mumm the AFL heart-throb was a major hit throughout the day as fans mobbed the midfielder for pictures and selfies.But it wasnâ€™t just fans who wanted a piece of the chiselled Bulldogs player, TV personality Karl Stefanovic took his chance for a photo op with Smith planting one on his cheek.Gemma and Bailey set pulses racing. (Photo by Sam Tabone/Getty Images)Karl Stefanovic and Bailey Smith. Pic: InstagramThe VIP enclosure was a hotbed for AFL stars with premiership heroes Jordan de Goey and Josh Daicos spotted in the marquee.But it was Smith who stole the limelight as he posed alongside countless Derby Day racegoers for happy snaps.Bailey Smith in the Birdcage at Flemington on Derby Day 2023. Picture: Magner Media/SuppliedThe day out at the races comes after Smith endured a tumultuous season that saw him left out of the Bulldogsâ€™ stacked midfield.As the AFLâ€™s off-season rolled on, reports emerged the midfielder is an â€œ80 per centâ€ chance of leaving the Dogs at the end of next season.Smithâ€™s contract expires at the end of 2024 and according to the Herald Sunâ€™s Jon Ralph: â€œThe chances of him moving on seem to be about 80 per cent.â€œSo the onus is on Smith to work his butt off to improve his kicking and on-ball craft so (coach) Luke Beveridge simply has to give him more centre bounce opportunities.More CoverageBrutal news for champion Cup jockeyâ€˜Adjust our plansâ€™: Cup under storm threatâ€œThen he can either stay on a significant deal or explore the market at the end of 2024.â€œThis year his lack of impact meant Beveridge wasnâ€™t proved wrong by pushing him to half forward.â€Smith has been linked with a move to Hawthorn and Geelong, but two other clubs including premiers Collingwood are believed to be â€œneck deepâ€ in a pursuit of Smith.

caption: He's revealed some behind-the-scenes drama went down. ðŸ‘€ Full story: https://bit.ly/40olRVw
article_title: Dave Hughes reveals massive Block auction error
article_text: Dave Hughes was a surprise attendee at this yearâ€™s Block auctions â€“ with a paddle in hand, suggesting he was interested in at least one of the properties on offer.But Hughes kept quiet as the auctions turned into a tense duel between two multi-millionaires with Block history: serial Block buyer Danny Wallis, and the man who bought last yearâ€™s winning property, Adrian Portelli.In the end, Portelli emerged victorious, buying three out of five Block homes for a total spend of $12.4 million. Dave Hughes at The Block auction.The first auction was the biggest of the day, with Steph and Gianâ€™s house racing out of the gates with an opening bid from Wallis some $650,000 over the reserve.Incredibly, Hughes, who was standing near Wallis and his â€œpeople,â€ claimed on-air today that the bid had been rather a large error on Wallisâ€™ part.â€œHe has meant to say $2,999,000 and he said $3,999,000 â€“ that was a mistake from Danny. That mistake got the ball rolling,â€ he revealed on 2DayFMâ€™s Hughesy, Ed & Erin this morning. Appearing as a guest on the program, Portelli confirmed that his rival had â€œstuffed upâ€ his opening bid: â€œI saw him backtrack, realise what heâ€™d done, and I thought Iâ€™d put the nail in the coffin.â€ From there, the auction took another dramatic turn when a young woman in the crowd collapsed and was taken away in an ambulance to receive medical attention.It was later revealed the woman was a registered bidder on Queensland couple Leah and Ashâ€™s home â€“ later on in the finale, with one of their interested buyers in hospital, the pair chose to pass in their home before it reached reserve. Hughes revealed he played a key role as the action unfolded. Last nightâ€™s auctions became a showdown between Portelli (left) and Wallis (right). Picture: Supplied/Channel 9â€œI actually caught the woman who collapsed â€“ me and one other bloke, the bloke from consumer affairs. I was the one who stopped the auction,â€ he said. â€œI said, â€˜Weâ€™ve got to stop the auction, this woman has collapsed.â€™â€Portelli also revealed the tactic behind his bizarre choice to bid against himself during Eliza and Libertyâ€™s auction, repeatedly raising the house price by $100,000 despite already having the highest bid.Hughesy bought Block contestants Josh Barker and Elyse Knowlesâ€™ house in 2017. Source: Channel NINEâ€œIt was a bit of a tactic to scare everyone off so we donâ€™t get into a bidding war â€¦ it was more just a chance to have a bit of fun and showpony,â€ he admitted.He said he was â€œout to prove a pointâ€ with his major cash splash at this yearâ€™s auctions, after being â€œabsolutely shredded by the publicâ€ after last yearâ€™s finale.Portelliâ€™s arrival at last yearâ€™s auctions, where he bought Omar and Ozâ€™s house for a massive $1.58 million over reserve, led to viewer speculation his purchase had been pre-organised to deliver that team a win. Portelli fiercely denied those claims, and later offered the house as a prize via his online lottery business. More CoverageBizarre Block auction reveals huge problemâ€˜Heartbreakâ€™ at wildly varied Block auctionsAnd while Hughes didnâ€™t bid on any of this yearâ€™s Block houses, he is holding on to a tidy investment after his involvement in a prior Block auction.Hughes paid $3.067 million for the five-bedroom home in Elsternwick, built by contestants Josh and Elyse in the 2017 season of Nineâ€™s long-running reno show.After weathering much speculation heâ€™d overpaid for the property, he revealed last week that a recent valuation put the house at around $5 million now. Read related topics:The Block

caption: Australiaâ€™s population is ageing dramatically, and this trainer has set out to target the one essential dimension of movement that is often overlooked.
article_title: Instructor reveals what Aussies are missing from their workout
article_text: Welcome to You Got This, news.com.auâ€™s weekly fitness series featuring stories and ideas from real women whoâ€™ve experienced it all.Australiaâ€™s population is ageing dramatically, and there is little available to help those wanting to remain agile.But now Simon NGO, from Flow Athletic, has created a 45 minute workout called the Best Burn Ever that is intended to bridge the gap of what is lacking and what is important as we age.The National Library of Medicine states that balance dysfunction is an issue with ageing adults, and there is an increased probability of falls in older adults which can cause loss of independence and death.Simon NGO created the Best Burn Ever workout. Picture: Supplied/Tom RobinsonThe class involves strength training, HINT cardio, mobility and flexibility training, and the burn many have come to love from the field of pilates. â€œThe program starts with a full body warm-up followed by a mobility flow. Following that, three distinctive working sets: standing work; plank/side bodywork; supine glute and abdominal work,â€ Simon told news.com.au. The workout involves core and stability training using single leg balancing for an extended period of time and combining exercises to target three dimensions of movement.â€œThe beauty of the program is that it can be done to any tempo, and the fact that it is an extended working set of 60-90 seconds per exercise combination, each participant can simply focus on their own execution within that working duration,â€ Simon said.â€œWe have seen older clients starting out gentle with smaller range of motions and gradually introducing bigger ones in time and substituting the more high impact moves with strengthening alternatives.â€He said that apart from the three main functions of fitness â€“ strength, cardio and mobility â€“ people also get the benefit of standing balance and mobility skills, in a sense that is very similar to dancing.The workout focuses on building stability. Picture: Supplied/Tom RobinsonSimon said the class was incredibly beneficial to those who were wanting to work on their stability.â€œNot only just the burn, but also that foundation. Clients have already reported improvements on range of movement and motor skills,â€ Simon said.â€œI envision The BBE to be something that fills in the gaps in that market and something that can be easily shared and taught to other fitness professionals out there.â€ROAD TESTI tried out the Best Burn Ever at the Flow Athletic studio in Paddington, Sydney, and was so excited to take part in it. I may not be an ageing adult just yet but my balance is absolutely shocking. Itâ€™s something I have been trying to work on through pilates and barre classes, so this seemed like a logical next step.First off, this class is hard in the best possible way. Itâ€™s meant to be challenging but you donâ€™t walk away feeling miserable about yourself. If anything, youâ€™re driven to do better next time. It is definitely one instructors encourage you to take at your own pace. There are different levels of difficulty and you can level up and down depending on your needs.As with everything, the class starts with a warm up before beginning to challenge you with different movements such as elevating one leg on a weight while doing various squats and pliÃ©s to activate your glutes and core to encourage balance.The class I attended had people of all ages in it. Picture: Supplied/Tom RobinsonItâ€™s fun! The vibe is amazing, the music is pumping and it definitely feels more like a dance class rather than a serious pilates class.More Coverageâ€˜Unnecessaryâ€™ fitness trend thousands loveClass pilates lovers need to tryUsually, Iâ€™d track the workout on my Apple Watch to share how many calories were burned but this class isnâ€™t about that. Itâ€™s about something so much more important. Although, a sweat was definitely worked up during this workout. Make no mistake about that.Looking around the class, it was a mix of men and women, young and old, with varying levels of fitness but everyone had a component they struggled with. It just goes to show how everyone needs to improve this part of their fitness journey.It is definitely a workout I will be recommending to friends â€“ I agree with Simon, who created the workout, that many people often overlook the importance of stability training. It was good to see a workout that really hammers the message home.

caption: JUST IN.
article_title: Braydan Collier, 13, and Kaine Bell, 14, have been identified as victims of horror Ashcroft crash, as adult passengers named
article_text: Best mates Braydan Collier, 13, and Kaine Bell, 14, have been identified as the young victims of a crash in western Sydney on Monday morning.The two boys were killed after a silver Ford sedan slammed into a telegraph pole and a jacaranda tree on Maxwell Ave in Ashcroft at high speed on Monday, splitting the vehicle in two and throwing one of the young boys from the car.The two men in the front of the vehicle are claimed by police to be Nicholas Thew and Anthony Morris, reports The Daily Telegraph. The pair allegedly remain on the run tonight.Police believe the vehicle was travelling about 50km/h above the speed limit.Braydan Collier, 13, was killed in a horror crash at Ashcroft on Monday. Picture: SuppliedHis best mate Kaine Bell, 14, was also killed in the crash. Picture: SuppliedBraydan had just celebrated his 13th birthday on Sunday, the day before he and his best mate would be killed in the horrifying crash.Graphic CCTV footage captured the moment two adult men â€“ who, the newspaper reports, â€œplayed surrogate big brother rolesâ€ in their lives â€“ pulled themselves from the wreck, stepped over the boysâ€™ bodies and fled the scene. One of the men could be heard yelling to his fellow front seat passenger â€œI wanna go homeâ€ as they ran, leaving the teenagers behind.A man was seen moving one of the boys from the car and then fleeing the scene. Picture: SuppliedNicholas Thewâ€™s younger brother Dridyn told The Telegraph his family was horrified by the accident.He said he and his mother had taken the young victims â€œunder their wingâ€.â€œMumâ€™s more worried about the two little boys, she tried to take them under her wing, she took Kaine and Braydan under her wing even though she struggles herself,â€ he said.â€œTheyâ€™re little ones I took under my wing to keep out of trouble, but I havenâ€™t seen them for two days and look where they are now.â€œMy younger brother went around there and identified them. Iâ€™m heartbroken.â€Police are investigating a fatal car crash on Maxwells road in Ashcroft, in southwest Sydney on Monday morning. Picture: NCA Newswire / Gaye GerardEmergency services were called to Maxwells Ave in Ashcroft, in Sydneyâ€™s southwest about 10.50am on Monday after a grey sedan smashed into a tree and a pole outside a home.Braydan and Kaine died at the scene. The boys, who were both rear-seat passengers, were reportedly thrown about 5m from the crash site.CCTV footage of the crash, which is too graphic to show in full, shows the moment the car leaves the road, before smashing through a small tree in front of a home and ploughing into a power pole, splitting the car in two. The rear of the vehicle ends up at the top of a homeâ€™s driveway.The sedan was split in two by the impact of the crash. Picture: NCA Newswire / Gaye GerardMoments after the crash, an adult male can be seen on the recording pulling himself from the front wreck before moving toward where the rear of the car is.He can be seen passing the body of one boy laying on the ground before pulling the other from the wreckage, pushing him to the ground and running back to help free another man from the front wreckage. He returns to check on the child who had been thrown from the car, before putting his hands on his head and running away.Locals could later be seen trying to help the Braydan and Kaine, before covering their bodies with blankets.NSW Police are investigating the crash and the events leading up to it as they hunt for the two men who ran from the wreck that Assistant Commissioner Brett McFadden said was â€œclearly avoidableâ€.Mr McFadden told reporters on Monday police were also searching for a third person who was riding a dirt bike that was seen travelling near the Ford at the time of the crash.â€œWe are looking for that driver to present themself so we can speak to him. We do not know what role, if any, he has played in the crash, but it is certainly an active line of investigation,â€ he said.He urged the pair who fled the vehicle to come forward, warning: â€œwe will find themâ€.â€œThey just need to present themselves to a police station, so we can engage with them and they can assist us with the inquiries and work out how this tragic situation unfolded,â€ Mr McFadden said.Police and detectives descended upon the Ashcroft street to investigate the fatal crash. Picture: NCA Newswire /Gaye Gerardâ€œTwo families are now going to be experiencing the absolute heartache that is to have some lives taken from them, which are clearly avoidable.â€â€œJust seeing the scene from the side of the road, just the absolute destruction of that vehicle, anyone that would have witnessed that crash would have no doubt been traumatised by it,â€ he added.More CoverageSickening CCTV from crash sceneA crime scene has been established, which specialist police from the Crash Investigation Unit will forensically examine.The crash happened just metres from the front door of a suburban home, although there are no further reports of other people hurt or vehicles or property damaged in the incident.Anyone with information in relation to this incident is urged to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. Anonymous reports can also be made to Crime Stoppers online.Read related topics:Sydney

caption: It's the feel-good content we all need! ðŸ˜
article_title: Jude Law has been spotted at Paul McCartneyâ€™s show in Australia
article_text: A-lister Jude Law has been spotted having the time of his life in a busy Brisbane crowd, and it is the feel-good content we all need. The Academy Award nominated actor got his boogie on at Paul McCartneyâ€™s concert on the Gold Coast. Law, 50, was dancing and singing, and it looked like he was having the time of his life. He was looking low-key in a black top and jeans and dancing to the banger Hey Jude. It was exactly what youâ€™d want any Jude to do in such a situation. Jude Law is having the time of his life. Picture: suppliedJude was getting into it. Picture: suppliedIt is no secret that Australia loves it when any celebrity is seen living among us in our board shorts, thongs and obsession with Bondi Le Sands. So thereâ€™s no denying it was fun to see the huge star enjoying the show alongside a bunch of excited Aussies. So how did we lure the movie star here? Well, Law is in town filming the new Ron Howard movie Eden. Not much is known about the upcoming blockbuster, but it is set to be a survival thriller. Law has been one of the acting worldâ€™s most famous faces for decades, and heâ€™s had one of the most public and messy celebrity relationships. Jude and Sienna dated for years. Picture: Steve Finn/Getty ImagesThey were a 2000s power couple. Picture: David Westing/Getty ImagesHe famously dated â€˜itâ€™ girl Sienna Miller in the early 2000s, although they ultimately broke up after Law had an affair in 2005. In unusual celebrity fashion, he publicly admitted to his infidelity. â€œI just want to say I am deeply ashamed and upset that Iâ€™ve hurt Sienna and the people most close to us,â€ Law said.Miller and Law split but ended up getting back together in 2008 and ultimately broke up again around 2011. He is a huge star. Picture: Alberto E. Rodriguez/Getty Images for DisneyMiller never said much about the experience, but in 2020 she described it as the most challenging â€œmoments.â€More CoverageHollywood star touches down in Sydneyâ€˜Playing victim cardâ€™: TV star blasts castmateâ€œI hope Iâ€™ll ever have to experience. Because with that level of public heartbreak, to have to get out of a bed, let alone stand in front of 800 people every night, itâ€™s just the last thing you want to do,â€ she toldThe Daily Beast in 2020. Since then, Law has kept a much lower profile but opened up in 2018 about what he dislikes most about being so incredibly famous. â€œI think the thing I loathe is that you subconsciously are aware of, say, how you look or how you act, even when you know youâ€™re not in the public eye,â€ he said. Read related topics:Brisbane

caption: Heâ€™s hit back with his own side of the story. ðŸ‘€ Full story: https://bit.ly/3SAjcpQ
article_title: Kristy and Brettâ€™s The Block agent reveals what really went wrong
article_text: The Melbourne real estate agent who ran Kristy and Brettâ€™s disastrous The Block auction has since hit out at the coupleâ€™s scathing criticism of him, saying buyers â€œdidnâ€™t see the valueâ€ in their house.South Australian couple Kristy and Brett profited just $65,000 on Sundayâ€™s finale, which came hot off the heels of Steph and Gian and Eliza and Libertyâ€™s mega windfalls â€“ $1.65 million and $1.05 million, respectively.The controversial husband-and-wife team, who emerged as â€˜villainsâ€™ on this season of the Channel 9 show, immediately hurled blame on their agent, Belle Propertyâ€™s Sam Inan, after he opened bidding at â€œhigh twosâ€, despite Kristy and Brett saying they wanted to kick off at $3.2 million.What transpired was rather uncomfortable viewing, with Inan being brutally called out on national TV for doing a subpar job.â€œOur agent s**t the bed with our game plan,â€ a flabbergasted Kristy said.Belle Property agent Sam Inan was brutally called out on The Block finale.Kristy and Brett were fuming over their agentâ€™s strategy. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9Midway through the auction, when things werenâ€™t going to plan, Brett got in a frosty confrontation with Inan as they convened privately.â€œWhat the hell?â€ Brett said. â€œYou mentioned high twos, we spoke about starting the bid at $3.2m? Mate, I canâ€™t believe how thatâ€™s just gone.â€ Host Scott Cam even had a crack, telling Inan, â€œYou probably set the scene by mentioning $2.9m at the start. That got in everyoneâ€™s head. We just donâ€™t mention anything. We know what the others went for.â€Further, Kristy and Brett were frustrated Inan appeared to annoy big spender Adrian Portelli by referring to his lucrative lottery business as a â€œraffleâ€ during the auction, which the multi-millionaire later admitted turned him off making a bid.â€œWe do spend a lot of time, money and effort educating people about the nature of our business and unfortunately people like that... Thereâ€™s a big, legal fine line between a raffle and what we do, so when we do hear the word raffle, we sort of shun that,â€ Portelli told Hughesy, Ed & Erin Monday morning. â€œIt sort of put a negative spin on it, [and] I did back away a tad because of that.â€ Kristy and Brett had the lowest earnings on this yearâ€™s season. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9The problems didnâ€™t end there, with Kristy and Brett also fuming that Inan declared the house was on the market, which essentially gave away their reserve price.Speaking after the show, Inan claimed a Consumer Affairs representative was on his case during the auction, urging him to state when the house was on the market.â€œWith Consumer Affairs [Victoria] in attendance itâ€™s very hard not to answer truthfully,â€ he said to Domain after the auction. â€œYou can sometimes say, â€˜Look Iâ€™ll answer you when Iâ€™m ready.â€™ But the reality is, with Consumer Affairs there â€“ and theyâ€™re knowing what the paperwork says â€“ itâ€™s very, very hard to do anything but tell the truth.â€œThey actually followed me around during the break and said, â€˜Youâ€™d better make sure you reiterate that itâ€™s on the market â€“ I donâ€™t think everyone heard youâ€™.â€That aside, Inan claimed there was simply â€œno money left in the roomâ€ following the first two sales, which were both bought by Portelli.He said buyers â€œdidnâ€™t see the valueâ€ in Houses 1 [Kyle and Leslie], 2 [Leah and Ash] and 3 [Kristy and Brett].â€œWhen I spoke to some of the buyers that didnâ€™t bid on our properties they said they didnâ€™t see the value in our homes, full stop,â€ he said.â€œIt had nothing to do with whether they were cheap or affordable on the day. They just didnâ€™t like them.â€â€˜They didnâ€™t see the value.â€™ Inan argued the poor result wasnâ€™t his fault.Following the finale, there was an outpouring of support for Inan on social media, with thousands of viewers taking to a post of Kristy and Brett on The Blockâ€™s official Instagram page to say they â€œfelt sorryâ€ for the agent.â€œAm I the only one who feels really sorry for this estate agent?â€ one person wrote. â€œHeâ€™s only human and heâ€™s on TV. Itâ€™s easy to just slip up when youâ€™re nervous. I think it is so wrong showing someone being grilled by 3 people while they stand there alone in front of a camera. Poor guy, at the end of the day if people actually wanted their property and wanted to support them theyâ€™d be buying it.â€Another added, â€œThe way they spoke to the real estate agent shows why they are so undeserving of money.â€A third wrote, â€œNot the agents fault. Price is indicative of the attitude displayed throughout the season. No responsibility and no ownership from this couple. The first buyer spent $5mil and said Steph and Gian are great people.â€ Inan told news.com.au he was doing fine, adding the awkward situation was â€œall in a dayâ€™s work.â€The Block 2023 auction results:Steph and Gian, House 4: Reserve of $3.35 million, sold for $5.000 million = $1.65 million profit + $100,000 prize money = $1.75 million (a Block record)Eliza and Liberty, House 5: Reserve of $3.25 million, sold for $4.3 million = $1.05 million profitMore CoverageBizarre Block auction reveals huge problemBlock winners answer burning questionKyle and Leslie, House 1: Reserve of $2.97 million, sold for $3.1 million = $130,000 profitKristy and Brett, House 3: Reserve of $2.97 million, sold for $3.035 million = $65,000 profit.Leah and Ash, House 2: Reserve of $2.97 million not met, passed in at auction.Read related topics:MelbourneThe Block

caption: JUST IN
article_title: Daylesford pub car crash victims named: Pratibha Sharma, daughter Anvi, partner Jatin Chugh; dad Vivek Bhatia and eldest son killed
article_text: A loving mother who once ran for state parliament, her nine-year old daughter, and her partner have been identified as three of the five victims in the Daylesford pub tragedy at the weekend.They died alongside a dad an his eldest son. The two families were good friends and were holidaying together in country Victoria when the horror crash happened. Pratibha Sharma, 44, her daughter Anvi, 9, and partner Jatin Chugh, 30, were killed after being hit by a BMW at The Royal Daylesford Hotel on Sunday evening. Vivek Bhatia, 38, and his eldest son were also killed in the smash.Loved ones have expressed their shock and grief at the death of Ms Sharma, who was a devoted community volunteer, domestic violence advocate and worked as a registered migration agent before recently becoming a lawyer.Pratibha Sharma, her daughter Anvi and partner Jatin Chugh all died after being hit by a BMW in the beer garden of The Royal Daylesford Hotel on Sunday evening.Family friend Preet Singh told the Herald Sun Ms Sharmaâ€™s death was â€œincredibly shockingâ€ and a tragedy, given her â€œpromising futureâ€.â€œIâ€™m short of words. I canâ€™t really believe this,â€ Mr Singh said, he was reportedly on his way to Ms Sharmaâ€™s Point Cook home to be with her parents in the wake of the tragedy.Vivek Bhatia, who died in the crash, and his wife Ruchi, who survived. Picture: Facebookâ€œShe was so happy, everything was going right for her,â€ he said.â€œShe loved her family, her career was going well. She had such a promising future. Life can be tragic. We never know when our time is up.â€Ms Sharma volunteered at Australian Sikh Support, and secretary Gurjit Singh said she was particularly active during the Covid-19 pandemic.â€œShe would deliver food boxes to people at home in quarantine,â€ he told the Herald Sun.He said she was also helpful providing immigration support to people in the community, and added it was a â€œterrible time for their familyâ€.Ms Sharma and Mr Chugh died at the scene. Picture: SuppliedNine-year-old Anvi later died in hospital. Picture: SuppliedIn 2018, Ms Sharma ran as an independent candidate for the seat of Werribee and two years later was a candidate for in the Wyndham City Council Elections.In an article written during her local election campaign, she was described as â€œcourageousâ€ and â€œcompassionateâ€ and â€œready to go an extra mile to serve the communityâ€.According to the article, Ms Sharma was a registered Migration Agent and volunteered for a number of causes, and had been actively involved in social work helping victims of domestic violence. â€œShe lives with her six-year old daughter and elderly parents and knows the importance of family,â€ the article reads.â€œShe is courageous, virtuous and compassionate and has always lent a helping hand to the community when required.â€Ms Sharma was admitted as a lawyer in the Supreme Court of Victoria in June this year. Picture: SuppliedIn June, Ms Sharma was admitted as a lawyer in the Supreme Court of Victoria and wrote on Facebook her family were key to her success.â€œI (would) like to thank you everyone for this achievement (...) especially my daughter Anvi who is always been the biggest motivation for me,â€ she wrote.Loved ones have left glowing, heartbroken tributes to Ms Sharma, Mr Chugh and young Anvi on social media.A BMW crashed into the beer garden at The Royal Daylesford Hotel on Sunday evening. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenPolice are investigating what caused the incident and are set to interview the 66-year-old driver on Tuesday. Picture: Brendan BeckettFive people were killed and multiple people injured after they were struck while sitting in the hotel beer garden outside. Picture: Brendan Beckettâ€˜Cheekyâ€™ boy among deadTwo members of the Bhatia family, from Tarneit an outer-west Melbourne suburb, also died in the incident. Vivek Bhatia was remembered as a â€œgood person and a really good fatherâ€.â€œI am with his parents now and itâ€™s such a big loss,â€ said Bhupinder Bhullar.The boy meanwhile was described as â€œreally cheekyâ€. Wife and mum Ruchi Bhatia, 36, and the coupleâ€™s younger son survived the crash with injuries. The Bhatia family of which dad Vivek and his eldest son died. Picture: Facebook.Vivek and Ruchi Batia. Picture: Facebook.As well as the five killed, five more people were injured when an SUV crashed into the beer garden at The Royal Daylesford Hotel after 6pm on Sunday, hitting customers sitting outside.Ms Sharma and Mr Chugh reportedly died at the scene, but Anvi later died at hospital.More CoverageSad details of beer garden crash victimsInside the sleepy town rocked by tragedySeveral others â€“ including an 11-month-old baby boy â€“ were also injured.While a heart breaking picture has emerged of the families ripped apart in the nightmare incident, police are still working to establish the connections of the other parties injured in the crash. The driver of the BMW, a 66-year-old Mount Macedon man, was taken to hospital with non-life-threatening injuries where he is expected to remain for police to interview him on Tuesday. Read related topics:Melbourne

article_title: The Block 2023 winners share secret behind their big win
article_text: This yearâ€™s winners of The Block have shared the secret behind how they secured their big win. Steph and Gian walked away winners after selling their property on Charming Street for a whopping $1.65 million over reserve.Their huge profit managed to even beat out last yearâ€™s winners, Omar Slaimankhel and Ozman â€˜Ozâ€™ Abu Malik, who landed a $1.6 million profit. Steph and Gian scored a huge win at action during the The Block 2023 auctions. Picture from Channel 9.Following their win, Steph and Gian have revealed the surprising strategy behind their showstopping win, and it turns out the pair were playing the long game. â€œWhen we got the call that we were on The Block in February, the first thing we did, I think three days later, we called Tom Spanos our auctioneer,â€ they told the Daily Mail. â€œHe was the first person we called and engaged, and people probably wouldnâ€™t think that. As soon as you find out youâ€™re on the Block, why would you call an auctioneer?â€â€œFor us, it was the end game. There was a lot of thought that went into that. The team at Ray Way Sunbury are exceptional.â€The Sydney-based couple also revealed that building their home came to an end, they made the decision to stick around in Melbourne for three months to keep networking with potential buyers. The happy couple have opened by about the strategy behind their big win. Picture from Channel 9.Their strategy worked like a charm, and in the end they sold their home to Adrian â€˜Mr Lamboâ€™ Portelli for a cool $5 million. More CoverageBlock agent reveals what really went wrongBizarre Block auction reveals huge problemSince securing their win theyâ€™ve both been in high spirits, and are already excited about a possible reunion with the rest of their castmates. â€œAll couples are such good friends. Weâ€™re looking forward to the many reunions that we will be having if not yearly, monthly,â€ added the pair. â€œWeâ€™ve left with amazing friendships. We had this really unique bond and respect for each other and I think everyone should know that.â€Meanwhile, with the addition of $100,000 in prize money, Steph and Gian, both 27, are now $1.75 million richer. Not bad for a few months work!

caption: Some of the world's most famous women were all recently spotted out together, and it's exposed one wild thing they have in common. ðŸ˜³
article_title: Taylor Swift shares a weird connection with her famous pals Sophie Turner and Gigi Hadid
article_text: Taylor Swift, Sophie Turner and Gigi Hadid were seen hanging out together in New York City - and they have one bizarre thing in common. Swift, Turner and Hadid have all dated the same man and that man is Joe Jonas, yet they have remained firm friends. The trio were seen out on the town together and were joined by a slew of celebrity pals, including model Cara Delevingne, actor Selena Gomez and NFL WAG Brittany Mahomes. Jonas, of course, was seen as an â€˜itâ€™ boy in the early 2000s thanks to the success of his band The Jonas Brothers. It was a period of skinny jeans, side fringes and starring in Disneyâ€™s Camp Rock, with the singer dating his fair share of famous women over the years.The girls were all hanging out. Picture: JosiahW / BACKGRIDThe friendship group seems like goals. JosiahW / BACKGRIDBoth Hadid and Swift dated him but Turner took it one step further and married Jonas, with the pair sharing daughters, Willa, 3, and Delphine, 1. This year, the couple announced they were divorcing and immediately called in the lawyers to argue about what country their two children would live in. Turner is from the United Kingdom and wanted to raise their two daughters there, but Jonas wanted them to stay in America. Theyâ€™ve since reached an agreement. Taylor and Joe dated in 2008. Picture: Photo by Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagicSophie and Joe got married in 2019 and have now broken up. Picture: Dia Dipasupil/Getty ImagesSince their split was announced, Turner has been spotted hanging out with Swift numerous times and there are reports sheâ€™s been staying in the singerâ€™s penthouse in New York City during the difficult time. It is interesting because Swift famously dated Jonas in 2008 and later complained on The Ellen DeGeneres Show that he broke up with her in a 27-second phone call. â€œWhen I find that person that is right for me, heâ€™ll be wonderful! When I look at that person, Iâ€™m not even going to remember the boy who broke up with me over the phone in 27 seconds when I was 18,â€ she famously said. In 2015, the pair were spotted hanging out together again, not because theyâ€™d gotten back together but because Jonas had started dating Swiftâ€™s good friend, Hadid. Joe Jonas and Gigi Hadid dated in 2015. Picture: InstagramGigi dated Zayn and ended up having a daughter with him. Picture: Dominique Charriau/WireImageThey lasted for a few months but eventually broke up. There was no dramatic reason and a few months later Jonas started dating Turner and they married in 2019. Swift famously acknowledged their relationship in her song Invisible String in 2020.â€œCold was the steel of my axe to grind. For the boys who broke my heart, now I send their babies presents,â€ she sings.If that wasnâ€™t weird enough, thereâ€™s even more men crossover in the dinner group. Hadid went on to have a child with One Directionâ€™s Zayn Malik.Bella and The Weeknd were very on/off. Picture: Busacca/Getty Images/AFPThe Weeknd and Selena Gomez dated in 2017. Picture: Angela Weiss/AFPThe couple broke up in 2021 and earlier this year rumours went wild that Gomez was dating Malik. There was never any confirmation of the romance besides online sleuths once declaring that the ex-boy band member was holding Gomezâ€™s bag when he was spotted taking photos with fans.More CoverageThis is who tells Taylor Swift what to doTaylor Swift reaches billionaire statusGomez has also dated the same man that Hadidâ€™s younger sister, Bella Hadid, has dated. Both dated singer The Weeknd, aka Abel Makkonen Tesfaye. He dated Bella Hadid in 2015, they broke up, and he ended up dating Gomez in 2017.Then they called it quits and he dated the younger Hadid again, but they called it ended it for good in 2019.

article_title: New 40k scholarships to tackle nationwide teacher shortages
article_text: Thousands of students will be eligible for scholarships of up to $40k as part of a national bid to lure more people into teaching. About 5,000 scholarships will be up for grabs for students starting teaching degrees in 2024, with applications open from Monday. This came after admissions data showed that university applications for education degrees dropped nearly 20 per cent this year, compared with 2023.Government modelling predicts shortages of more than 4,000 high school teachers in Australia by 2025.New scholarships of $40k each will be available for undergraduate teaching students over four years and $20k will be on offer for postgraduate students over two years.The program will be targeted at high-achieving school leavers, mid-career professionals, First Nations peoples, people with disability and students living remotely, according to the government.Those completing undergraduate degrees will be required commit to teaching in a public school or early learning centre for at least four years. Post graduate students will have to stick to at least two years of teaching. Students completing their final year professional experience placements in remote communities may also be eligible to receive a top-up sweetener of $2k.The government has allocated over $337m to its overhaul Australiaâ€™s struggling education sector. Picture: Gaye Gerard/NCA NewsWire.Federal Education Minister Jason Clare said the scholarships will help to tackle chronic workforce shortages plaguing schools across the nation.The announcement came days after the government launched a national campaign to elevate the status of teaching.â€œTeachers do one of the most important jobs in the world, but we donâ€™t have enough of them,â€ Mr Clare said.â€œI want more young people to leap out of high school and want to become a teacher, rather than a lawyer or a banker.â€

caption: "You want everything given to you on a plate but you really need to understand thatâ€™s just not how it works." ðŸ˜¬
article_title: Millennial worker blasts â€˜lazyâ€™ Gen Z work from home habit
article_text: A millennial has issued a grim warning to â€œmiserableâ€ Gen Z workers, urging them to reconsider their anti-office stance for the sake of their careers.Corporate worker Toby, who works in the tech industry and goes by TechToby online, has upset the younger members of the workforce by claiming they wonâ€™t be able to get ahead if they donâ€™t make an effort to go into the office.The 27-year-old has more than 11,900 TikTok followers and often shares career advice. Recently he released his top tips to â€œtripleâ€ your salary, telling people in their early 20s that they need to be in the office because they wonâ€™t be able to â€œbuild a networkâ€ when they are working from home and instead not â€œshowing their faceâ€ in an office environment.After receiving backlash to the advice, Toby doubled down on his stance, saying the reason he believes young people need to be in the office more is because theyâ€™re â€œall miserableâ€, â€œdonâ€™t have any confidenceâ€ and â€œlack serious social skillsâ€.Toby believes young people need to â€˜show their faceâ€™ in the office in order to be successful. Picture: @techtoby/TikTokHe said Gen Zers were â€˜lazyâ€™ and â€˜lacked social skillsâ€™. Picture: @techtoby/TikTokâ€œI only see this problem with Gen Z people who have started working from home because of the impacts of Covid,â€ he said.â€œBarely any of you get paid good money and I can categorically tell you, you arenâ€™t going to get these internal pay rises by not showing your face and staying at home.â€While the millennial doesnâ€™t recommend young people go in five days a week, noting they â€œcanâ€™t afford itâ€ and it is draining, he does believe once or twice a week is beneficial.â€œYou are missing out on vital knowledge from older people, people who have gone through your process,â€ he said.â€œSome of you are going to be stuck on $30,000, $40,000 a year for the rest of your lives because you donâ€™t know how to negotiate and you donâ€™t know how to get promoted.â€Toby warned Gen Z could be missing out on opportunities by staying at home, such as the ability to put their hands up for new projects that may only be talked bout in person.He worked five days a week in an office from the age of 17 to 22, claiming there was â€œno wayâ€ he would have gotten the internal promotions he did by â€œsitting at homeâ€.The video sparked a strong reaction from young workers. Picture: iStockâ€œA lot of you guys are just lazy. I understand it, you have been brought up in a different generation to what I was brought up in. You want everything given to you on a plate but you really need to understand thatâ€™s just not how it works,â€ he said.The tech employee urged young people to â€œwork smarterâ€ and be â€œmore savageâ€ than their co-workers if they want to â€œdo well in lifeâ€.â€œFocus on your high income skills, get the experience you need and you will earn very good money,â€ he said.However, not everyone was in agreement with Tobyâ€™s advice, with many claiming his points simply donâ€™t apply in a lot of situations.â€œThereâ€™s no one in the office to impress. My entire team is remote. Boomer mindset,â€ one person said.More Coverageâ€˜World is overâ€™: Work act Boomers hateWoke reasons Gen Z are turning down jobsâ€œThis is only relevant for small â€“ medium sized companies. My work has multiple offices in the same city, in person networking isnâ€™t viable,â€ another wrote.One person claimed the 27-year-old was â€œassuming so muchâ€ when making his videos.â€œEverything is about leverage â€“ you can WFH and still grow your career faster than others with leverage,â€ they said.

caption: They've revealed what they're going do with their massive windfall. ðŸ’¸ Full story: https://bit.ly/3tVKjS2
article_title: The Block winners Steph and Gian answer fansâ€™ burning question
article_text: After another nailbiting auction day on The Block, one couple has broken records and walked away with a â€œlife-changingâ€ profit.NSW childhood sweethearts Steph and Gian emerged as this seasonâ€™s clear winners during Sunday nightâ€™s finale after their home was bought for a whopping $5 million by Adrian Portelli.After their $3.35 million reserve, that gave them a record-breaking profit of $1.65 million, overtaking the $1.586 million benchmark set by 2022 winners, Omar and Oz.The Block winners Steph and Gian. Picture: Channel 9With the addition of $100,000 in prize money, Steph and Gian, both 27, are now $1.75 million richer.Shortly after their win during the prerecorded auction on Saturday, the â€œoverwhelmedâ€ pair said on camera that besides â€œclearing [their] debtâ€, they had â€œno ideaâ€ what to do with their massive windfall â€“ but speaking to 9Entertainment afterwards, they teased a â€œbigâ€ project.â€œItâ€™s going to clear our debts in Sydney, itâ€™s going to really set us up for the next stage,â€ Gian told the publication.â€œThereâ€™s [sic] big things in the pipeline,â€ he added, with Steph quickly echoing: â€œBig things.â€Their home was a judgesâ€™ favourite throughout the season. Picture: Channel 9Elsewhere during the rollercoaster auction, Melbourne sisters Eliza and Liberty placed second with a $1.05 million profit after their home sold for $4.3 million.More Coverageâ€˜Heartbreakâ€™ at wildly varied Block auctionsBrutal result for controversial Block couplesWAâ€™s Kyle and Leslie came in third with $130,000 after theirs went under the hammer for $3.1 million.All three houses were snatched up multi-millionaire Adrian Portelli, who also bought last yearâ€™s winning Block house.Meanwhile, South Australian couple Kristy and Brett pocketed $65,000 after selling their house for $3.035 million, while Queenslanders Leah and Ash were caught in the nightmare scenario of not having bids climb above their $2.97 million reserve, forcing them to pass it in.Read related topics:The Block

caption: The TV host has been hit with questions after paparazzi photos sparked speculation online.
article_title: Sonia Kruger addresses â€˜pregnancyâ€™ rumours after paparazzi photos emerged
article_text: Sonia Kruger has been forced to address baseless pregnancy rumours which were fuelled by paparazzi photos last week.The Channel 7 host, 58, stepped out at the MediaWeek 100 Power Lunch last month, with images published on the Daily Mail at the time that ultimately triggered social media speculation.Kruger dropped into KIIS FMâ€™s Kyle and Jackie O Show studio onMonday morning, where co-host Kyle Sandilands prompted her to discuss the photos in question, saying, â€œDaily Mail was inferring that you were pregnant.... But it was just the angle of the dress.â€TV host Sonia Kruger seen at a business lunch on Friday. Picture: MEDIA-MODE.COMJackie â€˜Oâ€™ Henderson continued, â€œI saw you that day and the weird thing was, you did not have that protruding belly at all. Sonia, youâ€™ve got a flat stomach.â€Kruger confirmed she was not pregnant, adding she got a â€œshockâ€ when she saw the photos in question.â€œIt was so weird actually, even I got a shock when I saw those pictures â€¦ Either I have a gluten intolerance, or the pictures may have been doctored,â€ Kruger said.â€œI can confirm there is no [pregnancy]. Maybe I should stop eating bread.â€The photos of Kruger were published in the media. Picture: MEDIA-MODE.COMSandilands then asked Kruger to â€œget your gut outâ€ live on-air, with The Voice host obliging as she showed off her flat tummy.â€œOh my god, thatâ€™s like an ironing board. Itâ€™s flat as,â€ Sandilands commented.Kruger showed off her flat stomach on the show.Kruger shares one child, daughter Maggie, with her long-term partner, Seven executive Craig McPherson.The couple welcomed Maggie in 2015 after several years of trying to conceive via natural methods and IVF.More Coverageâ€˜Disgustingâ€™: Abbie slams Sonia KrugerStar apologises after Logies speech blunderKruger, who won the Gold Logie this year, revealed at the time of her pregnancy she fell pregnant thanks to an egg donor.â€œI wanted to be really clear today on the show with our viewers and let everybody know that I did go through IVF and I did have an egg donor,â€ she said on Today in 2014.â€œI have a very good friend who basically gave me an egg and thatâ€™s how this pregnancy came about.â€

caption: Adrian Portelli and Danny Wallisâ€™ showboating antics left some viewers cold. ðŸ˜¬ Full story: https://bit.ly/3SsBtFy
article_title: The Block auctions: Adrian Portelli and Danny Wallisâ€™ showboating antics leave some viewers cold
article_text: The fate of this yearâ€™s contestants on The Block largely rested in the hands of two eccentric multi-millionaires during Sunday nightâ€™s finale; men so obscenely rich one could make several $100,000 bids against himself without breaking a sweat.But the gauche displays of wealth left some viewers cold, once again asking if The Block has lost touch with its roots after 19 seasons on air. For some years now, millionaire Danny Wallis has been the man to impress for contestants hoping to make a tidy profit on their homes. Wallis had tickled viewers and infuriated auctioneers during previous The Block auctions, with his love of making confusing, super-specific bids down to the cent.Danny Wallis: Fond of a confusing bid.Adrian Portelli: Will bid against himself if nobody else is interested.Last year, a new odd rich dude entered the fray: â€˜Lambo Guyâ€™ Adrian Portelli, who bought Omar and Ozâ€™s house for a sky-high price to deliver them a then-record-breaking $1.68m profit.And last night, viewers watched as Portelli and Wallis were locked in a bidding battle across several properties. Wallis was up to his usual tricks, leaving the auctioneers struggling to keep up while he dropped head-scratching bids like â€œThree million, nine hundred and ninety nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety hundred dollars â€¦ and ninety nine cents.â€ Portelli (left) and Wallis shake hands after another bizarre auction. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9But Portelli had some bizarre auction tactics of his own, bidding against himself not once but twice during sisters Eliza and Libertyâ€™s auction. Both times, he raised the price by $100,000 â€“ apparently, just because he could.â€œThatâ€™s â€¦ never happened before,â€ said a dumbfounded Scott Cam, while the auctioneer called it â€œthe strangest auction Iâ€™ve ever done.â€Those showboating antics meant huge financial windfalls for the contestants whose properties Portelli bought this year â€“ three in total, for a combined spend of $12.4 million.Young Sydney couple Steph and Gian fared best, breaking all Block records with an astonishing $1.75m season win. Eliza and Liberty also became instant millionaires, making a profit of $1.05m, and Kyle and Leslie scored a respectable $130,000 profit when Portelli bought their house in a less hotly contested auction. All smiles: Portelli just made Steph and Gian millionaires. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9But the two couples who couldnâ€™t spark the interest of either of these duelling multi-millionaires fared worse: Kristy and Brettâ€™s property limped over reserve to give them meagre winnings of $65,000, while Leah and Ash pulled their house from auction as it crawled towards the reserve, scared of suffering a similar fate.Without interest from Portelli or Wallis, Kristy and Brett made just $65k. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9Which begs the question â€“ are these the more indicative Block auction results? Take two incredibly rich men with a love of televised auction showboating out of the mix, and would everyone have walked away with next to nothing? Viewers expressed their frustrations on social media as the auctions unfolded:Someone just casually outbidding their own bid by $100,000 meanwhile the rest of us are struggling to buy groceries. The bids this season are making it hard to watch, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not competitive just a splash of cash. Makes me sad but also feel a bit sick lol #theblockâ€” S (@vlada_sasha) November 5, 2023Remember how we all complained about how there are always so many people at the auction but only a few bid....well now there is one guy bidding and he has to bid against himself just to make it even seem like an auction! #TheBlockâ€” Colonel Kickhead (@colonelkickhead) November 5, 2023Can we get a season of the Block where they create much less expensive, beautiful homes normal people can bid on? ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s boring with the same 3 bidders every time. Could add interest by getting to know the new bidders & their motivation and be more relatable. #TheBlock@TheBlockâ€” Shaken&stirred (@Shakenstirred8) November 5, 2023These  #TheBlock auctions are taking the absolute piss now. Old mate and his 99999999999999999999999 bids and old mate just out bidding himself. pic.twitter.com/Kgj5BHyJMwâ€” Non Sensible Kate (@nonsensiblekate) November 5, 2023So Steph and Gian made $1.65m profit. The final two bid rises being *1 cent* and then *$1 million dollars*, for a final sale price of $5 million. Very normal! #TheBlockâ€” Daryl MaguireÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s tractor (@DarylTractor) November 5, 2023Outrageous bidding is taking the fun out of watching an auction. No normal people bid like that. #TheBlockâ€” Akeem (@Bruce79215079) November 5, 2023The houses donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sell for what they are worth - hence why no normal genuine buyer should ever bid for them. They sell at an amount the two multi-millionaires want to give the contestants. Tip. Be the nice guys next year! #TheBlockâ€” bridgpa (@bvam14) November 5, 2023So let me get this right, a house is on the market with a bid at $4m (reserve $3.35m) with the room not filled with contested bidders and someone makes a $1m bid - unnecessarily - and buys the house for $5m. What am I missing?? #TheBlockâ€” Peter Filopoulos (@peterfilopoulos) November 5, 2023Keen to give contestants the best shot at winning a life-changing amount of money, the show has leaned into the interest from these super-rich men in recent seasons. Wallis has even been offered up as a mid-season prize, with contestants competing for a chance to take him to dinner and quiz him about what he looks for in a home. And this season, couples tried to appeal to Portelliâ€™s famed love of sports cars with luxury mod cons like a driveway vehicle turntable. This yearâ€™s Block winners Steph and Gian said they were â€œoverwhelmedâ€ by their massive win after the weekendâ€™s auctions, telling 9Entertainment they had a â€œbigâ€ project planned with their $1.75 million winnings. More Coverageâ€˜Heartbreakâ€™ at wildly varied Block auctionsBrutal result for controversial Block couplesâ€œItâ€™s going to clear our debts in Sydney, itâ€™s going to really set us up for the next stage,â€ Gian told the publication.â€œThereâ€™s big things in the pipeline,â€ he added, with Steph quickly echoing: â€œBig things.â€As for Portelli, as with last yearâ€™s purchase, he says he plans to use all three Block properties as fodder for his lucrative online lottery business, offering them up as prizes for punters who pay to enter his competition draws. With an estimated net worth of $350m, youâ€™d have to assume the man feels this $12m auction day was another savvy business move.

article_title: â€˜Lucky manâ€™: Adelaide Crowsâ€™ Wayne Milera announces elopement
article_text: Adelaide Crows defender Wayne Milera has tied the knot with his long-term partner Nina Starkey.Milera and Starkey announced their marriage on Instagram, sharing a series of beautiful snaps of their wedding day on November 1.Watch every match of the 2023 NAB AFLW Season LIVE & ad-break free during play on Kayo Sports. Join now and start streaming instantly >Captioned â€œLucky man!â€ with a series of emojis, the photos showed happy couple embracing by the sea, on the beach and eating their wedding cake.The coupleâ€™s celebrant revealed on Instagram they eloped last Wednesday.Adelaide Crows defender Wayne Milera has married long term partner Nina. Picture: InstagramThe happy couple celebrate their elopement. Picture: InstagramThe wonderful news was met with messages of congratulations from Mileraâ€™s teammates.â€œCongratulations brother,â€ wrote goalkicker Taylor Walker.â€œAmazing you two,â€ wrote Rory Sloane with some heart eyes emojis.Milera and Starkey announced their engagement in July last year. They welcomed their first child, Carter, in 2021.Milera has played 96 AFL games since making his debut in 2016 including a career high 22 appearances for the Crows this season.Wayne Milera and Nina Starkey have tied the knot. Picture: Emma BrasierMilera has played 96 games for the Crows. (Photo by Mark Brake/Getty Images)The 26-year-old is the latest AFL star to celebrate happy personal news during the off-season.More Coverageâ€˜Forever with youâ€™: AFL starâ€™s â€˜unrealâ€™ newsAFL starâ€™s sweet engagement revealPort Adelaide young gun Conor Rozee announced his engagement to his partner Maisie Packer, capping off another strong season that saw the 23-year-old earn his second All Australian blazer.Richmondâ€™s Jayden Short also announced he had popped the question to his partner Maddy Bekiaris during a European holiday.â€œCIAO FIANCEE!!â€ they captioned the sweet snaps.Read related topics:Adelaide

caption: The seven-time Melbourne Cup winner is "just sick of it".
article_title: Melbourne Cup king Lloyd Williamsâ€™ damning take on â€˜depressingâ€™ race
article_text: Cups king Lloyd Williams has taken an extraordinary swipe at the great race as he chases his eighth Melbourne Cup. The colourful racing identity on Monday made surprising comments about the â€˜Race that Stops the Nationâ€™ as he prepares to watch his runners Cleveland and Serpentine in the $8 million handicap. Williams won the first of his Cups 43 years ago and on Monday shared his opinions about how the race has been on a downhill slide in recent years. Watch the Melbourne Cup LIVE with RACING.COM on Kayo Sports. Join now and start streaming instantly >Williams, who last tasted Cup victory with Twilight Payment in 2020, says it can all be traced back to the emergence of corporate bookmakers in recent years.The Crown Casino founder and larger-than-life punter said the flood of new betting agencies had taken away from the spectacle of the frantic scenes surrounding bookmakers at the track. The 83-year-old, who is the most successful owner in Melbourne Cup history, will not attend the race this year. â€œItâ€™s depressing. Corporate bookies have made it all very disappointing,â€ he told RSN Breakfast. Jockey Kerrin McEvoy celebrates his Melbourne Cup win on Almandin with owner Lloyd Williams. Photo by Michael Dodge/Getty Images.â€œYou need the blokes on the rails going up and down the rails. Back in 1987 was a perfect day when Kerry Packer put about $7 million on the second horse (in the Sydney Cup). Thatâ€™s what you need. Now itâ€™s all very depressing. You need a bit of colour.â€Williams has been involved in some of the most celebrated punting wins in Australian racing, having famously shared a $10 million pay-out with Packer when they landed the quinella in 1998.The frank owner was happy to spill the beans about his extraordinary punting records.â€œWhen you could really get on, I didnâ€™t mind having 2, 3, 4, or five hundred thousand,â€ he said of the bets he wagered. â€œWhat can you get on with these blokes these days. They shut your account, donâ€™t they? Theyâ€™ve taken the colour away from the game, actually. Disappointing. Disappointing. â€œI just get sick of their ads.â€Owner Lloyd Williams celebrates with the cup. Photo by Paul Rovere/Getty Images.Williams has linked up with hall of fame trainer Gai Waterhouse in the Cup with Irish horse Serpentine, considered a long shot. He also has the Kris Lees-trained Cleveland.Williams made headlines earlier this week with a brazen declaration about Cup favourite Vauban, saying Packer would have triggered betting anarchy by putting a fortune on the red-hot favourite in different times. â€œIf I was back in my punting days with Kerry, we would certainly make this horse start a very warm favourite,â€ Williams told racenet.com.au. â€œIf Kerry and I were having a proper bet, we would be on the favourite to win plenty.â€œI donâ€™t bet any more. But Kerry and I used to have a lot of fun gambling.â€œIf I was back in my days with Kerry we would certainly make this horse start favourite.â€Williams has piled pressure on the French horse and jockey Ryan Moore, saying they look almost unbeatable. â€œIf you saw him he looks like a gridiron player, he is a tough horse,â€ he said.More CoverageMelbourne Cup rumour rocks entire fieldSad truth about Melbourne Cup golden girlâ€œHe is not terribly tall and he is the perfect looking animal.â€œI have been to Werribee a couple of times and I know the team who have got the favourite.â€œHe will be extremely difficult to beat.â€Read related topics:Melbourne

caption: â€œThis is some privileged sh**."
article_title: Outrage over Aussie womanâ€™s birthright citizenship â€˜passport hackâ€™
article_text: An Aussie social media influencer revealed she gave birth in Central America so her family could get dual nationality.In a now-viral post, Shannen Michaela explained that over the past few months she has been working on a â€œcomprehensiveâ€ guide to Jus Soli.It is also known as â€˜birthright citizenshipâ€™ which ultimately means her child will gain an extra passport.It also means parents of the child will gain permanent residency, â€œwith a pathway to citizenshipâ€.The 24-year-old health and wellbeing influencer, however, has been heavily criticised over her post with many slamming her using â€œwhite privilegeâ€ with her â€œbirth tourism citizenship hackâ€. â€œI flew from Australia to Costa Rica to give birth and give my child an extra passport,â€ she said.Shannen Michaela, an Aussie Instagram star, revealed she gave birth in Central America so her family could get dual nationality.â€œI know from first hand experience how much research, time and energy goes into the whole process; especially if you plan to get a passport in a country you have not visited before.â€The mother-of-one who now holds Costa Rican, British and Australian passports described the birthright citizenship as â€œthe most accessible way to obtain an extra passportâ€. â€œIt is an investment in your family, your childâ€™s future and generations to come.â€Shannen said it is a â€œlegal form of immigrationâ€ with 31 countries involved that grant birthright citizenships including Costa Rica and the USA. She was able to do it under Jus Soli â€“ also referred to as birthright citizenship.The list also includes countries in the Caribbean, such as Jamaica and Trinidad and Tobago, a well as Lesotho in southern Africa, and Fiji in the Pacific.Her clip titled â€˜Have a baby and get an extra passportâ€™ has attracted almost half a million views and has been met with hundreds of divisive comments.Some have thanked the influencer for sharing details of birthright citizenship, adding they are considering to make a move to one of the abiding countries, while others have described it as being for â€œrich peopleâ€. â€œThis is some privileged sh**,â€ one person wrote.â€œNew Age colonialism,â€ said another, to which Shannen responded: â€œAbsolutely notâ€.Jus Soli â€“ Latin for law of soil â€“ means citizenship of a country is based on being born there.Michaela said â€œmore and more people are leaving the West and searching for a Plan Bâ€.â€œWith an additional passport, you always have an alternative place to go,â€ adding that getting a second citizenship was a â€œprotection in case anyone tries to restrict your freedom of movementâ€™â€.â€œYou can choose which tax systems you want to be part of and diversify your assets. Travel freedom is personal freedom and the more passports you collect the more opportunity you create for your family, including generations to come.â€However, this comment didnâ€™t go down too well with some of her almost half a million followers.It allows the child to gain an extra passport and also means parents of the child will gain permanent residency, â€˜with a pathway to citizenshipâ€™.One person sparked a flurry of comments after saying Shannenâ€™s clip is â€œessentially anchor baby instructions for rich peopleâ€.â€œWho the f*** do you think has a bunch of money to fly to a foreign country for weeks when heavily pregnant? Who has money to up and move their entire life?â€ one person asked.Another said: â€œYou literally said the words â€˜diversify your assetsâ€™ â€¦ you are 100 per cent pointing this video at a specific socio-economic class. Youâ€™re either lying or so stupid you donâ€™t see it. Either way doesnâ€™t bode well for your image.â€ One person defended the Aussie saying it was a very common thing. She said â€˜With an additional passport, you always have an alternative place to goâ€™.â€œI have plans to move to South America and keep working remotely from any country I wish. Travelling is not only a rich people thing,â€ they wrote. However, the original commenter fired back saying: â€œI didnâ€™t say that birth tourism was a rich people thing. Itâ€™s been done for decades.â€â€œI said that this was an instructional video for well-off digital nomads on how to drop an anchor baby.
