She has an amazing gift with horses, they relax so well for her, and they respond to her.â€œLooking ahead to a two-mile (3200m) race they are important factors when selecting a jockey for a horse.Jamie Kah was the golden girl of Australian racing right from the start. Photos: Instagram and Scott Barbour via Getty Images.â€œItâ€™s amazing what Jamieâ€™s achieved during her career and weâ€™re looking forward to Tuesdayâ€™s race. What sheâ€™s been through in the last 12 months is unbelievable, sheâ€™s a real athlete, sheâ€™s well prepared and sheâ€™s a great thinker, a great horse person.â€œI think weâ€™ve got one of the worldâ€™s best riding on Tuesday.â€If successful, Kah would become only the second female jockey to win the Melbourne Cup after Michelle Payne, who won on $101 chance Prince Of Penzance in 2015.But a win would make her achievement all the sweeter given Kah was fighting for her life only eight months ago after a shocking race fall, ironically at Flemington.Kah, who scored a confidence-building double at Flemington on Derby Day, said of riding in another Melbourne Cup: â€œIâ€™m very excited to ride (More Felons) in the Cup.â€œItâ€™s a very, very special race for Australia and Iâ€™m happy to be on him, I know heâ€™ll run the trip, we just have to get him in a good spot.â€Jamie Kah after winning Race 4 on Spacewalk at Derby Day on November 04, 2023. (Photo by Vince Caligiuri/Getty Images)Kah, who grew up in the Adelaide Hills but now lives on Victoriaâ€™s Mornington Peninsula, finished an unlucky third in the 2020 Melbourne Cup on Prince Of Arran.The nine-time Group 1 winner missed the 2021 Cup and ran seventh last year on Smokinâ€™ Romans.â€œRiding in the Melbourne Cup is indescribable, how amazing it feels to be out there,â€ Kah said. â€œTo win the Melbourne Cup would be amazing, you got to be in it to win it and Iâ€™m in with a good chance.â€It has been the toughest year of champion jockey Kahâ€™s career in the saddle after she sustained a serious brain injury after a shocking fall in March.It kept her on the sidelines for five months and she eventually returned to race riding in August.Kah has struggled to recapture her elite form since returning from injury but has found plenty of allies as she strives to get back to the pinnacle of racing.Kah knows she has a huge opportunity on Tuesday. (Photo by Daniel Pockett/Getty Images)Michelle Payne said: â€œI think sheâ€™s just going through the motions of whatever sheâ€™s getting, the rides sheâ€™s getting (and) doing her best.â€œObviously itâ€™s very hard coming back from an injury like that but I think that sheâ€™s not panicking and you canâ€™t.â€œSheâ€™s not getting the calibre of horses that she was, but I think sheâ€™s still riding as good as ever.â€œIf I had a horse good enough for her to ride I wouldnâ€™t have any hesitations in putting her on. Itâ€™s a game where you need the luck to be going your way and I always say itâ€™s like a big circle, it keeps coming back around.â€œPeople that have ability are going great now and then itâ€™ll come around and sheâ€™ll be flying again. Sheâ€™s done a remarkable job to come back from her injury like she did and sheâ€™ll get back there.â€Kahâ€™s form slump coincides with her facing a misconduct charge over her part in a â€œwhite powderâ€ controversy, which will be heard over two days on November 13 and 14.In August, her barrister told the Victorian Racing Tribunal that Kah intended to plead not guilty.It is alleged Kah was filmed by a friend, registered stablehand Ruby McIntyre, appearing to arrange a white substance into three lines with an identification card during a gathering at her home on June 17-18.Kahâ€™s parents, John and Karen, represented Australia as Winter Olympians in short-track speed skating.Devoted to horses growing up in South Australia, Kah started her equestrian career working for pocket money in racing stables before becoming an apprentice jockey at the age of 14.ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s genuinely so nice seeing Jamie Kah smiling and happy again. Super ride by her on Cause for Concern. Great win! #DerbyDayâ€” AndrewPH (@AndrewPHopkins5) November 4, 2023She had her first race ride at Streaky Bay on South Australiaâ€™s Eyre Peninsula in March, 2012. She rode her first winner, Magic Tigress, at Clare on April 7, 2012.She has now ridden more than 1200 winners with career prizemoney of more than $71 million, of which she has received a 5 per cent share.In 2021, Kah became the first person - male or female - to win 100 metropolitan races in a season in Victoria.However, in the same year she hit the headlines for the wrong reasons when, in the middle of an intense Victorian lockdown, Kah was found to have hosted a rogue gathering at an Airbnb rental, breaching the stateâ€™s strict Covid rules.Kah was suspended from riding for three months, which Kah said â€œwas the worst time of my life, easilyâ€.â€œIâ€™ve worked so hard to make this image of myself,â€ she said in an interview in September last year.Jamie Kah takes the win on Cause of Concern on Saturday. (Photo by Vince Caligiuri/Getty Images)â€œI just wanted to be the best. I wanted to please everyone. â€œAnd I didnâ€™t want people to hate me. I used to get really upset with people not liking me. And when that happened, I thought Iâ€™d let down so many people in the world and that just killed me. I was not in a good place for a while.â€Waller said More Felons, a $34 chance in the Melbourne Cup, had â€œcontinued to do well while in quarantineâ€.â€œHis run in the Geelong Cup (5th) appears to have brought him along nicely,â€ he said. â€œThe horse made up good ground, sustained a long run which is a good quality looking ahead to Flemington.More CoverageMelbourne Cup favourites get huge boostTalented jockey lands dream Cup debut rideâ€œI was certainly happy with his performance at Geelong. I believe heâ€™ll relish stepping out to two miles (3200m) on Tuesday.â€Two other female jockeys will compete in the Cup.Champion British rider Hollie Doyle is aboard Future History, while Rachel King takes the ride on the Gai Waterhouse and Adrian Bott-trained Military Mission.Read related topics:AdelaideMelbourne

caption: He got the shock of his life.
article_title: Rat tailed road rager suddenly flees in terror
article_text: A furious man with a rat tail has been filmed getting out of his car and threatening another motorist â€” only to get the shock of his life.In the video, shared by Dashcam Owners Australia, a red VW hatchback is seen moving in front of the car of the person filming as they approach a red light.The man exits a red VW hatchback. Picture: XHe yells and gestures wildly at the other driver. Picture: XThe driver begins to open the door before the car comes to a stop and a burly Asian man sporting the distinctive hair cut, a black hoodie and blue trackies emerges.The enraged motorist does a few jaunty skips as he approaches the car behind, angrily yelling and gesticulating towards the other driver, apparently demanding he exit the vehicle.The man is sporting a distinctive hair style. Picture: XHe turns and bolts back to his car. Picture: XHe reaches the driver window and can be heard yelling expletives and hitting the car, as heavy metal music plays inside.Suddenly the man turns and sprints back towards his car â€” with two Victoria Police officers in hot pursuit.The video ends on a cliffhanger, but it appears unlikely the man was able to make a getaway.Two police suddenly appear. Picture: XIt wasnâ€™t immediately clear where or when the video was filmed.Victoria Police was unable to provide any comment.The viral clip has been viewed nearly 280,000 times since Saturday.â€œBro post-workout is a mad man,â€ one person wrote.More CoverageRoad rage incident goes terribly wrongGrim reason driver fled after hitting womanâ€œThe cute little skip at the start,â€ another said.â€œLook, I give him 2/10 for the dance routine when he first exits his car and 9/10 for the panicked return,â€ a third agreed.frank.chung@news.com.au

caption: There's awkward and then there is this.
article_title: Machine Gun Kelly storms off after interview moment with Formula 1 icon Martin Brundle
article_text: Machine Gun Kelly has stormed off after being the victim of a reverse â€œMartin Brundle momentâ€ at the Brazilian Grand Prix on Monday morning.The Formula 1 icon was back at his mortifying best at the Interlagos circuit before the race â€” which was won by Red Bullâ€™s Max Verstappen â€” when his traditional grid walk produced moments of sheer awkwardness. The Sky Sports F1 guru is used to being the person on the grid that gets snubbed by every A-list celebrity out on the track â€” but the dynamic shifted dramatically in Sau Paulo when the former driver gave the American rapper nothing during their awkward exchange. Watch every Practice, Qualifier & Race of The 2023 FIA Formula One World Championship Live and Ad-Break Free in racing on Kayo Sports. Join now and start streaming instantly >Things got off to a shaky start when the British reporter grabbed Kelly and asked how things were going in the superstarâ€™s career.Kelly batted away the question, saying: â€œMy career? I donâ€™t think about my career. I donâ€™t think about it.â€Machine Gun Kelly gave Martin Brundle the thumbs down. Photo: Fox Sports.Machine Gun Kelly walked off. Photo: Sky Sports.And it only got more awkward when he asked the Sky Sports interviewer to join him for a live air guitar and air piano session.Brundle uncomfortably declined multiple times by saying: â€œNo thereâ€™s millions [of people watching]. You do it!â€œI canâ€™t do it, I canâ€™t do it. I probably need to get on because weâ€™ve got some people to see.â€Machine Gun Kelly was left furious that he didnâ€™t join him in a peculiar jam session and stormed off from the interview and away from the camera.Brundle joked as he moved on that the Hollywood star may not be his biggest fan after the interaction.He said: â€œSomething tells me I wonâ€™t be on his Christmas card list.â€F1 commentator Matt Gallagher described it as the â€œweirdest Matin Brundle interview yetâ€. England Test cricket great Graeme Swann called it â€œmagnificently awkwardâ€. Plenty who enjoyed watching the car crash. Martin Brundle chatting to Machine Gun Kelly is absolutely sending me Ã°Å¸Â¤Â£Ã°Å¸Â¤Â£Ã°Å¸Â¤Â£Ã°Å¸Â¤Â£Ã°Å¸Â¤Â£ #BrazilGPâ€” Nikki Ã°Å¸Â§Â¡ (@life_of_niksi) November 5, 2023martin brundle grid walks make my tear up like wdym we got mgk knowing nothing about f1 and bernie eccelston getting questioned over his tax fraud in the same 5 minutesâ€” saff (@lovepiastri) November 5, 2023Others said the traditional grid walk is â€œpast its used by dateâ€Sorry, but BrundleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s gridwalk is past its sell by date. CringeworthyÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ #F1#BrazilGPâ€” Rob Myers (@RobLMyers) November 5, 2023Martin Brundle interviewing Machine Gun Kelly was so cringe it made me physically nauseatedâ€” khez Ã°Å¸â€¡Â§Ã°Å¸â€¡Â·Ã°Å¸Å½Å  (@oconyva) November 5, 2023the martin brundle pit walk interview with machine gun kelly was truly the stuff of cringeworthy nightmaresâ€” Kami Mattioli (@Kami) November 5, 2023Mr. Martin Brundle definitely needs to goto therapy after this grid walk. #BrazilianGPpic.twitter.com/SFKgCgWuOLâ€” Kasun Jayawardhana Ã°Å¸â€¡Â±Ã°Å¸â€¡Â° (@KasunMullegamg1) November 5, 2023It may not have even been Brundleâ€™s most awkward moment of the day. Fans loved the moment he gave former Formula 1 supremo Bernie Ecclestone a brutal tongue-lashing on live TV. Ecclestone last month admitted to failing to declare a Â£400million trust fund to the tax office in the UK.Brundle couldnâ€™t help but make a cheeky comment about Ecclestoneâ€™s troubles when they met on the grid. â€œYou had quite an amazing month with His Majestyâ€™s Revenue and Customs,â€ Brundle said.Ecclestone didnâ€™t know how to respond. It was a triumphant return for Brundle, who was last week bizarrely stood down from doing the track walk by Sky Sports. Formula 1 fans were not happy at the Mexican Grand Prix when Brundle was replaced by Danica Patrick and Bernie Collins.Patrick, the former IndyCar driver, and Collins, former Aston Martin engineer, strolled up and down the grid as they took over the famous segment.F1 fans weren't happy with Sky SportsBrundleâ€™s growing list of grid walk moments have sent the Formula 1 world into a spin throughout the entirety of the 2023 season.Fans were left in stitches at the US Grand Prix after he was forced to awkwardly wait his turn to speak to British boxer Anthony Joshua.Ahead of the Singapore Grand Prix, Aussie rookie Oscar Piastri was dealt a brutal burn when the Sky Sports presenter bailed on him mid-answer.In Miami it was three-time F1 champ Jackie Stewart who stole the limelight after he was almost manhandled during the grid walk shenanigans.Hollywood power couple Michael Douglas and Catherine Zeta-Jones won fans over with their classy interview ahead of the Spanish Grand Prix.At the British Grand Prix it was musician Sam Ryder who drew widespread praise for his infectious banter while speaking with Brundle.But the most famous incident of all also came at the British Grand Prix when Cara Delevingne was brutally roasted after snubbing Brundle.

caption: It was a brutal ending. ðŸ˜¬ WARNING: Spoilers. Full story: https://bit.ly/40pGyjY
article_title: Brutal auction result for The Blockâ€™s most controversial couples
article_text: It was a brutal end to The Block for this yearâ€™s two most controversial couples, who either walked away with comparatively little or failed to sell, while their rivals became instant millionaires.South Australian couple Kristy and Brett were perhaps the most adversarial team viewers have seen on The Block in some time, launching feuds with their fellow contestants, with the showâ€™s production team, and eventually, with their Block besties Leah and Ash.For their drama-filled season, the pair have scored a comparatively paltry profit of just $65,000 over their reserve. That works out to be around $5400 per week for the 12 weeks they were on The Block.Â â€œWe havenâ€™t even covered half of our wages for being here,â€ a tearful Kristy said as the auction closed. Kristy and Brett made just $65,000.And fellow controversy magnets, Queenslanders Leah and Ash, suffered the fate every Block couple dreads: their house failed to attract a bid above their $2.97 million reserve and so was passed in. One of their registered bidders had fainted earlier in the day, and needed to leave in an ambulance to receive medical attention. There is some hope for them, though: their house could still sell for more than its reserve after auction. Two of the three houses that were passed in during last yearâ€™s auctions eventually sold for well over their reserve, scoring their teams respective profits of around $170,000 each.A profit is by no means guaranteed, though. When the third house passed in at last yearâ€™s auctions did eventually sell, it was for $180,000 less than its original reserve, leaving last yearâ€™s contestants Dylan and Jenny with no profit at all from their time on The Block.Their house didnâ€™t sell, but thereâ€™s still hope for Leah and Ash.The showâ€™s executive producer Julian Cress said it had been â€œheartbreakingâ€ witnessing Kristy and Brettâ€™s disappointing auction result.â€œI think Kristy and Brett are two of the best contestants we have had on the show and I feelterrible for them that they had to go through that, after just watching their neighbours make a million plus. For them to make $65,000 is pretty heartbreaking,â€ he said.Kristy and Brett were left fuming with their auctioneer after he apparently veered from their agreed plan, openin the bids at $2.9 million and then confirming the house was on the market just as it hit reserve. From there, bidding slowed down, and the couple were left wondering how they could only scrape past their reserve following two million-dollar-plus profits. â€œAustralia got what they wanted,â€ an emotional Kristy said of their result, referring to the viewer backlash theyâ€™d copped throughout the season. The brutal auction results come after both couples sparked numerous feuds with their fellow contestants throughout the season. Kristy and Brett were vocal about their belief sisters Eliza and Liberty were getting special treatment by the showâ€™s producers, dubbing them â€œindustry plantsâ€ and complaining about them on camera while wearing Trump-style â€œMake The Block great againâ€ hats on camera.They could use those hats right now.Kristyâ€™s closest Block ally Leah confronted her on camera midway through the season, suggesting the negativity had gone too far â€“ which caused a bitter rift between them that lasted until the end of the season. â€œThis affected the rest of my experience on The Block. Some serious, deep issues went on. At the moment, most of the cast are trying to stay very positive and professional,â€ Leah told news.com.au midway through the season. She said there had been â€œabsolutely no realigningâ€ with Kristy and Brett after their rift began. The Block 2023 auction results:Steph and Gian, House 4: Reserve of $3.35 million, sold for $5.000 million = $1.65 million profit + $100,000 prize money = $1.75 million (a Block record) Eliza and Liberty, House 5: Reserve of $3.25 million, sold for $4.3 million = $1.05 million profitKyle and Leslie, house 1: Reserve of $2.97 million, sold for $3.1 million = $130,000 profitKristy and Brett, House 3: Reserve of $2.97 million, sold for $3.035 million = $65,000 profit. Leah and Ash, House 2: Reserve of $2.97 million not met, passed in at auction.Previous Block winners2003: BONDI â€“ Adam & Fiona, $256,0002004: MANLY â€“ Jamie & Andrew, $178,0002010: VAUCLUSE â€“ John & Neisha, $305,0002011: RICHMOND â€“ Polly & Waz, $115,0002012: SOUTH MELBOURNE â€“ Brad & Lara, $606,0002013: ALL STARS (BONDI) â€“ Phil & Amity, $395,0002013: SKY HIGH (SOUTH MELBOURNE) â€“ Alisa & Lysandra, $395,0002014: FANS v FAVES (ALBERT PARK) â€“ Steve & Chantelle, $736,0002014: GLASSHOUSE (PRAHRAN) â€“ Shannon & Simon, $435,0002015: TRIPLE THREAT (SOUTH YARRA) â€“ Darren & Deanne, $935,0002015: THE BLOCKTAGON (SOUTH YARRA) â€“ Dean & Shay, $755,0002016: PORT MELBOURNE â€“ Will & Karlie, $815,0002017: ELSTERNWICK â€“ Josh & Elyse, $547,0002018: GATWICK (ST KILDA) â€“ Hayden & Sara, $645,0002019: OSLO (ST KILDA) â€“ Tess & Luke, $730,000More CoverageBlockâ€™s sneaky trick to keep auctions a secretThe Block confirms huge change to show2020: BRIGHTON â€“ Jimmy & Tam, $1,066,0002021: FANS v FAVES (HAMPTON) â€“ Mitch & Mark , $744,4442022: TREE CHANGE (GISBORNE) â€“ Omar and Oz, $1,686,666.66Read related topics:The Block

caption: She's setting the record straight.
article_title: John Stamosâ€™ ex Teri Copley breaks silence on claim she was â€˜in bedâ€™ with TV star
article_text: Teri Copley is setting the record straight.Less than two weeks after John Stamos claimed he found her naked in bed with Tony Danza during their 1980s relationship in his memoir, If You Would Have Told Me, she recounted a very different version of the story via a 19-minute YouTube video shared on Friday.Instead of catching them in bed, Copley claimed Stamos knocked on her door while Danzaâ€™s car was fully visible in her driveway.When she opened the door â€œfully dressed,â€ she recalled her ex becoming upset, reports Page Six.â€œ[He] just shook his head and looked at me like, â€˜How could you?â€™â€ she claimed.â€œWell, I looked at him and didnâ€™t say anything either. I just looked at him like, â€˜What do you care?â€™â€â€œHe certainly didnâ€™t come in my house and find me in bed naked with a sheet over,â€ Copley added.â€œI mean none of that happened.â€Teri Copley and John Stamos dated in the â€˜80s. Picture: Ron Galella/Ron Galella Collection via Getty ImagesPage Six has reached out to a rep for Stamos but did not immediately hear back.Giving background on the timeline of the entire situation, the actress and model, 62, said she dated Danza, 72, for â€œabout a year and a half.â€She then met the Full House star and they instantly â€œhit it off.â€ Eight months into their relationship, Stamos told her he loved her.â€œIâ€™m a girl. I remember that very clearly because I was waiting and waiting for him to tell me that he loved me because I didnâ€™t know if he did,â€ Copley claimed.A few months later, a phone call from Stamosâ€™ mother, Loretta Phillips, completely changed her view on their relationship.â€œShe called and she said, â€˜Teri, I know that you love John, but donâ€™t plan on marrying him because he has no intention of marrying you,â€™â€ she recalled. â€œI remember like it was yesterday.â€Copley said she assumed Stamos told his mother that and thought she called to try and â€œprotectâ€ her.So, she went to the General Hospital starâ€™s home and broke up with him.â€œIt was my fault. I was young. I didnâ€™t know how to communicate with him to tell him, you know, your mother told me you didnâ€™t ever want to marry me,â€ she humbly recalled.â€œWe never discussed marriage and I wasnâ€™t, you know, secure enough [or] strong enough to say that to him. So I just left it like that. I left him like that.â€Thatâ€™s when Danza came into the picture.â€œThree or four daysâ€ later, Copley said she saw the Whoâ€™s the Boss? alum on the cover of a magazine.â€œI opened it and I read it and in there he said that Teri Copley was the only girl that heâ€™d ever loved,â€ she remembered.Copley hit back in a lengthy video. Picture: SuppliedShe says she dated Danza for about 18 months.The Redeemed actress said she then called Danza, who came over â€” but not to a pool house as Stamos claimed in his memoir.Not long after, she said Stamos showed up at her door to call her out.Copley went on to claim in her video that after Stamos and Rebecca Romijn divorced in 2005, she finally admitted why she broke up with him.â€œI wanted to because Iâ€™d grown up a little bit and I wanted to tell him what happened,â€ she stated.â€œAnd he looked at me and he said, â€˜I didnâ€™t know that, Teri.â€™â€â€œHe said, â€˜I would have married you. I was madly in love with you.â€™â€Following the conversation, Copley said she and Stamos were able to form a friendship.The dad of one also spoke about his relationship with Romijn, whom he was married to from 1998 to 2005, in If You Would Have Told Me.In the memoir, he accused the X-Men actress of treating him like he wasnâ€™t good enough for her and also of having an affair.â€œBetrayal starts as a sinking feeling in your stomach, grows into a suspicion that clouds your every thought, and by the time you find out the truth, itâ€™s uniquely horrible at first but also expected, like youâ€™ve been waiting for something bad to happen,â€ he penned.More CoverageStamos â€˜nearly quitâ€™ Hollywood over FriendsStamos ex â€˜blindsidedâ€™ by memoirâ€œThereâ€™s nothing more to say.â€Following the bookâ€™s release, a source told Page Six that Romijn â€œdoesnâ€™t want to give John any more oxygen or attention and help him sell more booksâ€ by responding to his claims.This article originally appeared in Page Six and was reproduced with permission.

caption: Adrian Portelli and Danny Wallisâ€™ showboating antics left some viewers cold. ðŸ˜¬
article_title: The Block auctions: Adrian Portelli and Danny Wallisâ€™ showboating antics leave some viewers cold
article_text: The fate of this yearâ€™s contestants on The Block largely rested in the hands of two eccentric multi-millionaires during Sunday nightâ€™s finale; men so obscenely rich one could make several $100,000 bids against himself without breaking a sweat.But the gauche displays of wealth left some viewers cold, once again asking if The Block has lost touch with its roots after 19 seasons on air. For some years now, millionaire Danny Wallis has been the man to impress for contestants hoping to make a tidy profit on their homes. Wallis had tickled viewers and infuriated auctioneers during previous The Block auctions, with his love of making confusing, super-specific bids down to the cent.Danny Wallis: Fond of a confusing bid.Adrian Portelli: Will bid against himself if nobody else is interested.Last year, a new odd rich dude entered the fray: â€˜Lambo Guyâ€™ Adrian Portelli, who bought Omar and Ozâ€™s house for a sky-high price to deliver them a then-record-breaking $1.68m profit.And last night, viewers watched as Portelli and Wallis were locked in a bidding battle across several properties. Wallis was up to his usual tricks, leaving the auctioneers struggling to keep up while he dropped head-scratching bids like â€œThree million, nine hundred and ninety nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety hundred dollars â€¦ and ninety nine cents.â€ Portelli (left) and Wallis shake hands after another bizarre auction. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9But Portelli had some bizarre auction tactics of his own, bidding against himself not once but twice during sisters Eliza and Libertyâ€™s auction. Both times, he raised the price by $100,000 â€“ apparently, just because he could.â€œThatâ€™s â€¦ never happened before,â€ said a dumbfounded Scott Cam, while the auctioneer called it â€œthe strangest auction Iâ€™ve ever done.â€Those showboating antics meant huge financial windfalls for the contestants whose properties Portelli bought this year â€“ three in total, for a combined spend of $12.4 million.Young Sydney couple Steph and Gian fared best, breaking all Block records with an astonishing $1.75m season win. Eliza and Liberty also became instant millionaires, making a profit of $1.05m, and Kyle and Leslie scored a respectable $130,000 profit when Portelli bought their house in a less hotly contested auction. All smiles: Portelli just made Steph and Gian millionaires. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9But the two couples who couldnâ€™t spark the interest of either of these duelling multi-millionaires fared worse: Kristy and Brettâ€™s property limped over reserve to give them meagre winnings of $65,000, while Leah and Ash pulled their house from auction as it crawled towards the reserve, scared of suffering a similar fate.Without interest from Portelli or Wallis, Kristy and Brett made just $65k. Picture: Supplied/Channel 9Which begs the question â€“ are these the more indicative Block auction results? Take two incredibly rich men with a love of televised auction showboating out of the mix, and would everyone have walked away with next to nothing? Viewers expressed their frustrations on social media as the auctions unfolded:Someone just casually outbidding their own bid by $100,000 meanwhile the rest of us are struggling to buy groceries. The bids this season are making it hard to watch, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not competitive just a splash of cash. Makes me sad but also feel a bit sick lol #theblockâ€” S (@vlada_sasha) November 5, 2023Remember how we all complained about how there are always so many people at the auction but only a few bid....well now there is one guy bidding and he has to bid against himself just to make it even seem like an auction! #TheBlockâ€” Colonel Kickhead (@colonelkickhead) November 5, 2023Can we get a season of the Block where they create much less expensive, beautiful homes normal people can bid on? ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s boring with the same 3 bidders every time. Could add interest by getting to know the new bidders & their motivation and be more relatable. #TheBlock@TheBlockâ€” Shaken&stirred (@Shakenstirred8) November 5, 2023These  #TheBlock auctions are taking the absolute piss now. Old mate and his 99999999999999999999999 bids and old mate just out bidding himself. pic.twitter.com/Kgj5BHyJMwâ€” Non Sensible Kate (@nonsensiblekate) November 5, 2023So Steph and Gian made $1.65m profit. The final two bid rises being *1 cent* and then *$1 million dollars*, for a final sale price of $5 million. Very normal! #TheBlockâ€” Daryl MaguireÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s tractor (@DarylTractor) November 5, 2023Outrageous bidding is taking the fun out of watching an auction. No normal people bid like that. #TheBlockâ€” Akeem (@Bruce79215079) November 5, 2023The houses donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sell for what they are worth - hence why no normal genuine buyer should ever bid for them. They sell at an amount the two multi-millionaires want to give the contestants. Tip. Be the nice guys next year! #TheBlockâ€” bridgpa (@bvam14) November 5, 2023So let me get this right, a house is on the market with a bid at $4m (reserve $3.35m) with the room not filled with contested bidders and someone makes a $1m bid - unnecessarily - and buys the house for $5m. What am I missing?? #TheBlockâ€” Peter Filopoulos (@peterfilopoulos) November 5, 2023Keen to give contestants the best shot at winning a life-changing amount of money, the show has leaned into the interest from these super-rich men in recent seasons. Wallis has even been offered up as a mid-season prize, with contestants competing for a chance to take him to dinner and quiz him about what he looks for in a home. And this season, couples tried to appeal to Portelliâ€™s famed love of sports cars with luxury mod cons like a driveway vehicle turntable. This yearâ€™s Block winners Steph and Gian said they were â€œoverwhelmedâ€ by their massive win after the weekendâ€™s auctions, telling 9Entertainment they had a â€œbigâ€ project planned with their $1.75 million winnings. More Coverageâ€˜Heartbreakâ€™ at wildly varied Block auctionsBrutal result for controversial Block couplesâ€œItâ€™s going to clear our debts in Sydney, itâ€™s going to really set us up for the next stage,â€ Gian told the publication.â€œThereâ€™s big things in the pipeline,â€ he added, with Steph quickly echoing: â€œBig things.â€As for Portelli, as with last yearâ€™s purchase, he says he plans to use all three Block properties as fodder for his lucrative online lottery business, offering them up as prizes for punters who pay to enter his competition draws. With an estimated net worth of $350m, youâ€™d have to assume the man feels this $12m auction day was another savvy business move.

caption: JUST IN
article_title: Athlete dies during Noosa Triathlon
article_text: A 53-year-old Victorian man has died during the swimming leg of the Noosa Triathlon on Sunday morning.The athlete was taking part in the 40th anniversary of the event at Main Beach, Noosa Heads, Queensland, when he was pulled from the water about 7.50am Sunday. Event organisers said the man immediately received aid from fellow athletes before he was pulled from the water for continued medical assistance by water safety and medical personnel.CPR was performed but the man was unable to be revived and declared dead at the scene. A Queensland Police Service spokesman said the 53-year-oldâ€™s death was being treated as non-suspicious.The 53-year-old man was pulled from the water on Sunday morning. Picture: Noosa Triathlon/News Corp AustraliaA Noosa Triathlon spokesman said the organisation was â€œdeeply saddenedâ€ to confirm the manâ€™s death, in a post on social media.â€œOur condolences go out to the athleteâ€™s family and friends, whom we will continue to offer our support,â€ they wrote. â€œWe thank the athletes who stopped to provide aid, as well as the first responders and medical personnel who worked quickly to provide (him) with medical support.â€The triathlon, which attracted over 7,000 competitors, includes a 1.5km swim, 40km bike race and 10km run.The manâ€™s death is understood to be the third fatality during the eventâ€™s 40 year history. More CoverageGrim details emerge after 5 killed outside pubFed-up crowd rallies for action on youth crimeIn 2004, athlete Peter Semos died after suffering a heart attack near the finish line of the run leg.Police are preparing a report for the coroner.More to come.Read related topics:Brisbane

caption: She's being hailed as the "luckiest woman alive", but haters say he's out of her league. Full story: https://bit.ly/47gmH9c
article_title: Iâ€™m dating the â€˜hottest man aliveâ€™ who people say is too sexy for me
article_text: A New York City woman is being hailed the â€œluckiest woman aliveâ€ after revealing her flawlessly fine boyfriend to a lustful audience of catcalling, tongue-wagging TikTok viewers. And while some hot-to-trot spectators are busy applauding the fortunate belle for bagging a buff, brown-eyed babe, haters are saying heâ€™s out of her league, the New York Post reports. â€œWTF is he doing with you?,â€ questioned a troll beneath a viral video shared by 25-year-old Brooklyn resident Nadya Okamoto, an lifestyle influencer and co-founder of lifestyle period brand August. In the post, which raked up a whopping five million TikTok views, Okamoto unabashedly celebrated her 31-year-old boyfriend Henry Stevensonâ€™s good looks, sharing fetching clips of the hunk accompanied by trending audio of a fawning woman. Nadya Okamoto's post garnered thousands of comments from men and women who were stunned by Stevenson's good looks. Picture: Nadya Okamoto/Instagramâ€œIâ€™m convinced Iâ€™m dating the hottest man alive and nobody can tell me otherwise,â€ says the popular sound bite used by Okamoto. The voiceover track was originally created by TikTok user @Howdypartner.jpg. â€œEvery single day Iâ€™m blown away by how f***ing hot this man is,â€ continues the audio. â€œAnd heâ€™s into me?â€Okamoto isnâ€™t the only one who feels her flame is the fieriest smoke show to hit the streets â€” digital droolers think so, too. â€œDamn maâ€™am, congratulations. Yes. Yes to it all,â€ cheered an impressed commenter. â€œIâ€™m a straight grown a â€“ man, whoâ€™s married and I got to say heâ€™s a good-looking guy!â€ admitted another. Okamoto's genetically blessed boyfriend Henry Stevenson. Picture: Nadya Okamoto/InstagramAdmirers compared him to the fictional Christian Grey, played by Jamie Dornan. Picture: Pascal Le Segretain/Getty Imagesâ€œOMG!!! He has no business being on Godâ€™s green earth looking like an angel straight from heaven lol,â€ an admirer added. Others begged Okamoto for her secret strategy on snapping up the heart-throb, cheekily pleading, â€œDrop the link for the dupe â€” I need,â€ and â€œAmazon link please?!? A dupe is also good!!â€ in the hopes of bagging Stevensonâ€™s equally dashing doppelganger. Many hot-and-bothered wannabes even likened the stud to the leading lover in the film trilogy 50 Shades of Grey.â€œLow key giving Jamie Dornan. You go girl!,â€ praised a fan whose remarks were echoed by a separate rooter who wrote, â€œReal-life Christian Grey!!â€Okamoto isnâ€™t the first woman to reach social media celebrity for her sweetieâ€™s showstopping sexiness. Fans of Okamoto applauded her for being both lucky and gorgeous. Picture: Nadya Okamoto/InstagramAuthor Hazel McBride, 29, was ushered into TikTok glory after unveiling her â€œinsanely hotâ€ husband to the masses in an internet-breaking post at the top of the year. Canadian content creator Alicia Mccarvell, too, sent jaws dropping when she showcased her muscled-bound man online in June 2022. Keyboard critics flooded Mccarvellâ€™s comments with venom, saying her hubby was â€œtoo hotâ€ to be with her. Unfortunately, both Okamoto and Stevenson received similarly shaded snipes from contrarian killjoys. â€œHeâ€™s cute and handsome â€” but not hot,â€ sneered a troll. â€œNo, heâ€™s definitely not hot,â€ another naysayer spat. â€œWtf is he doing with unhot you?,â€ added a cruel cynic, who was backed by a grump who said, â€œHe could have done soo much better.â€However, supporters leapt to Okamatoâ€™s defence, reminding the Brooklynite that sheâ€™s just as enchanting as her appealing Prince Charming. More Coverageâ€˜Dyingâ€™: Influencerâ€™s shock â€˜hygiene failâ€™Screenshot exposes what men are becomingâ€œStop underestimating yourself, youâ€™re gorgeous as well,â€ said a spirit-booster. â€œYouâ€™re a gorgeous couple, both of you,â€ another chimed. â€œI wish you lots of happiness.â€This story originally appeared on the New York Post and was reproduced with permission

caption: They've revealed what they're going do with their massive windfall. ðŸ’¸
article_title: The Block winners Steph and Gian answer fansâ€™ burning question
article_text: After another nailbiting auction day on The Block, one couple has broken records and walked away with a â€œlife-changingâ€ profit.NSW childhood sweethearts Steph and Gian emerged as this seasonâ€™s clear winners during Sunday nightâ€™s finale after their home was bought for a whopping $5 million by Adrian Portelli.After their $3.35 million reserve, that gave them a record-breaking profit of $1.65 million, overtaking the $1.586 million benchmark set by 2022 winners, Omar and Oz.The Block winners Steph and Gian. Picture: Channel 9With the addition of $100,000 in prize money, Steph and Gian, both 27, are now $1.75 million richer.Shortly after their win during the prerecorded auction on Saturday, the â€œoverwhelmedâ€ pair said on camera that besides â€œclearing [their] debtâ€, they had â€œno ideaâ€ what to do with their massive windfall â€“ but speaking to 9Entertainment afterwards, they teased a â€œbigâ€ project.â€œItâ€™s going to clear our debts in Sydney, itâ€™s going to really set us up for the next stage,â€ Gian told the publication.â€œThereâ€™s [sic] big things in the pipeline,â€ he added, with Steph quickly echoing: â€œBig things.â€Their home was a judgesâ€™ favourite throughout the season. Picture: Channel 9Elsewhere during the rollercoaster auction, Melbourne sisters Eliza and Liberty placed second with a $1.05 million profit after their home sold for $4.3 million.More Coverageâ€˜Heartbreakâ€™ at wildly varied Block auctionsBrutal result for controversial Block couplesWAâ€™s Kyle and Leslie came in third with $130,000 after theirs went under the hammer for $3.1 million.All three houses were snatched up multi-millionaire Adrian Portelli, who also bought last yearâ€™s winning Block house.Meanwhile, South Australian couple Kristy and Brett pocketed $65,000 after selling their house for $3.035 million, while Queenslanders Leah and Ash were caught in the nightmare scenario of not having bids climb above their $2.97 million reserve, forcing them to pass it in.Read related topics:The Block

caption: It was actually a secret signal. ðŸ‘€
article_title: Matt Preston reveals the secret hand gesture he used to make on TV
article_text: Matt Preston has revealed the truth about a â€œsecret hand gestureâ€ heâ€™d make while filming MasterChef.Speaking to news.com.au to promote his new memoir, Big Mouth (due out November 7), Preston said he came up with the on-screen gesture to let his wife, Emma, know that he was thinking of her.â€œThe first four years of MasterChef were shot in Sydney and my family lived in Melbourne,â€ the food critic explained.â€œSo I had to find ways when she was watching the show, of letting her know that she was there (in his mind).â€œAt that point, I used to wear two wedding rings on my left hand, so during tastings I would twist the ring on my finger â€¦ so that she could watch and know that I wasnâ€™t just lost in some strange MasterChef celebrity bubble but I was actually remembering her.â€Matt Preston making his 'secret hand gesture'.Matt and his family in 2013.Tension with Gary MehiganIn Big Mouth, Preston also reveals that things were â€œa little frostyâ€ between himself and fellow judge Gary Mehigan in season one of MasterChef in 2009.â€œYou have to understand that there is a fundamental cobra versus mongoose relationship between food critics and restaurateurs,â€ the cravat-loving star told news.com.au, adding that perhaps Mehigan wasnâ€™t thrilled with a review he had written about one of his restaurants in the past.â€œIâ€™m the guy who came to Garyâ€™s restaurant, The Boathouse, and had a wobbly table and wrote about how wobbly my table was. He wasnâ€™t happy.â€œSo there was a certain amount of professional suspicion, shall we say,â€ he laughed.Preston said the pair quickly sorted out their issues and he now considers Mehigan to be â€œone of my most trusted friendsâ€.Former MasterChef judges Matt Preston and Gary Mehigan. Picture: Peter WallisHounded by papsThe first few seasons of MasterChef made the three judges, Matt, Gary and George, household names in Australia.It also meant they were followed by photographers wherever they went.â€œI was told that a â€˜damagingâ€™ picture, you know, Matt Preston feeding his kindergarten age daughter junk food, was worth about $40,000, so you can understand why photographers were out there,â€ Preston told news.com.au.In Big Mouth, Preston shares a particularly amusing paparazzi-related story about his Channel 10 co-star, George.â€œGeorge thought he was being hounded because there was a photographer basically camped outside his house in Bondi,â€ he said.George was so annoyed by the papâ€™s presence that he decided to move out of the property.â€œHe was like, â€˜thatâ€™s it, Iâ€™ve got to leave, I canâ€™t be in Bondi anymore, thereâ€™s too many papsâ€™,â€ Preston recalled.As George was in the process of moving he out, he confronted the photographer.â€œHe was like, â€˜Iâ€™m going!â€™ and (the photographer) said, â€˜who are you?â€™â€ Preston laughed.It turns out the pap was actually camped out on the street to take photos of Lara Bingle who lived a few doors down.Matt with George in 2009.Matt Prestonâ€™s new book.MasterChef secrets revealedPreston shares some behind the scenes secrets about MasterChef in his memoir, Big Mouth.For example, he answers a question that gets asked on social media every season by viewers watching at home: â€œDonâ€™t the dishes go cold before the judges have a chance to taste them?â€â€œWe had a number of strategies to ensure that we could see the food in its best form,â€ Preston told news.com.au.One of the strategies was to get the contestants to make a second dish once the challenge had ended.â€œWeâ€™d taste that in a speed tasting before we did the main tasting,â€ Preston said. â€œWe would go around and look at things like how high the souffle had risen and were the chips crispy.â€The former MasterChef judges doing their thing.The former judge said theyâ€™d also taste the dishes as they were being made by the contestants.â€œWe were wandering around the whole time, you could see us in the back of each shot, poking into pots and tasting,â€ he said.â€œAll youâ€™re trying to do is make the playing field for the contestants as even as possible.â€Big MouthIn his memoir, Preston also writes about his adoption, his fractured childhood, some shocking family tragedies, his disastrous spell in the British Army and his burgeoning journalistic career in 1980s London. It will be released on November 7.

caption: â€œI felt used and abused. Disgusting is the only word."
article_title: â€˜Disgustingâ€™: Another woman speaks out about Russell Brandâ€™s alleged conduct
article_text: A woman who alleges comedian Russell Brand sexually assaulted her on the set of his film Arthur has spoken out, labelling his behaviour â€œdisgustingâ€.The actress, who was an extra in the 2011 movie, filed court documents in New York on Friday, alleging Brand exposed himself to her in full view of other cast members and then entered a bathroom with her and assaulted her.She claims a member of the filmâ€™s production crew â€œguarded the door from outsideâ€ during the alleged sexual assault.The woman has requested anonymity from the court, and has not been named in the media.â€œI felt used and abused. Disgusting is the only word,â€ she told Britainâ€™s Sunday Times in her first interview on the matter.â€œI felt like I was being used, that I was an object for his momentary titillation.â€Russell Brand in 2008. The alleged assault occurred two years later, during the production of Arthur in 2010. Picture: Jewel Samad/AFPIn court documents, the woman described her â€œextreme embarrassment, shame and fearâ€ as a result of Brandâ€™s alleged conduct.â€œI am trying to get my power back by speaking up about it,â€ she said.â€œAnd if there are other people who have had something like this happen, I want to help them have the courage to come forward too. Because honestly, thatâ€™s what gave me the strength to do this.â€She said Brand had appeared to be â€œintoxicatedâ€ on set, carried â€œa bottle of vodkaâ€ and â€œsmelt of alcoholâ€.Brand was recently the subject of an extensive investigation by The Times and Dispatches, a program on Britainâ€™s Channel 4, which accused him of engaging in sexual assaults, emotional abuse and even rape over a period spanning years.Brand denies any wrongdoing and maintains all his relationships were â€œconsensualâ€.â€œAlone, I donâ€™t think I would have felt able to (speak),â€ the woman said.â€œHopefully, when other women see another woman putting what happened to her out there, they will find the strength inside themselves to speak out.â€Brand addressing the allegations on his YouTube channel.The joint investigation covered allegations from four separate women.One alleges Brand raped her up against the wall of his home in Los Angeles. Another claims he had a relationship with her when she was 16, still a high school student, and he was in his thirties. She has accused him of engaging â€œin the behaviours of a groomerâ€.A third woman says she was assaulted by Brand in Los Angeles, telling him repeatedly to get off her, only to have him â€œflipâ€ and become â€œangryâ€. And a fourth alleges the comedian was both physically and emotionally abusive towards her in the UK.

caption: The Australian was caught up in the extraordinary drama at the Brazil GP.
article_title: Pure misery for Daniel Ricciardo after drama in Brazil
article_text: Daniel Ricciardoâ€™s day at the Brazilian Grand Prix was over before it even began.There was huge drama at the Interlagos circuit in Sao Paulo as two drivers crashed out in the opening lap with the incident sending debris all over the track â€” ruining Ricciardoâ€™s race.That crash came after Ferrariâ€™s Charles Leclerc went into the wall on the formation lap when he suffered a hydraulics failure. It was absolute carnage when the race was eventually able to re-start with Alex Albon making contact with Nico Hulkenberg at Turn 1. Watch every Practice, Qualifier & Race of The 2023 FIA Formula One World Championship Live and Ad-Break Free in racing on Kayo Sports. Join now and start streaming instantly >That contact pushed him into the other Haas of Kevin Magnussen.The second impact was far greater, sending both cars into the barrier and out of the race.Debris and multiple tyres were sent flying across the track and Ricciardo found himself in the wrong place at the wrong time with a rogue tyre bouncing across the track collecting his back wheel and rear wing.He was forced into the pits to repair the damage before the race re-started 30 minutes after the Magnussen crash. Aussie Oscar Piastri also took damage from the scattered debris and needed to pit. Daniel Ricciardo took contact from the bouncing tyre.Both were then given the awful news before the re-start that they would need to start from pit lane a lap behind the rest of the field.Ricciardo was absolutely seething about the verdict from FIA stewards and gave them a serve on his team radio after crossing the finish line. â€œI could rant and explain how f***ing s*** these rules are, but we all know it,â€ he said. â€œSo sorry for you guys. You did a great job repairing the car.â€He went on to say: â€œJust because Iâ€™m an arsehole, thanks FIAâ€. Ricciardo and Piastri never recovered from the blow and were left racing each other all alone, ultimately finishing the race 13th and 14th â€” the very last cars that were able to finish the race with six cars unable to make it to finish line. In another gut punch for Ricciardo and Piastri, the pair never got the yellow flag they needed to get back on the lead lap. Ricciardo finished more than 43 seconds behind the car in front of him. His teammate Yuki Tsunoda finished P9. At least the Australians were able to finish the race â€” unlike Albon, Leclerc, Magnussen, Valtteri Bottas, Zhou Guanyu and Mercedesâ€™ George Russell. Leclerc was perhaps the most miserable of the lot. Leclerc, who had started second on the grid, crashed on the formation lap in what David Croft called a â€œdisasterâ€ for Ferrari, with it later revealed he had a hydraulics issue, Sky Sports reports. â€œWhy am I so f***ing unlucky?â€ he repeatedly said over the team radio.Drama before the start! Ã°Å¸Â¤Â¯Leclerc has gone into the barriers on the formation lap #F1#BrazilGPpic.twitter.com/4gnA2LFACHâ€” Formula 1 (@F1) November 5, 2023Leclerc was not in the field after he lost control of his Ferrari on the formation-up lap before the initial start, which meant he was not allowed to rejoin even if his car could have been repaired.When the race resumed, it was Max Verstappen that got the best of Lando Norris on the re-start and then went on to cruise to another victory.Verstappen eased to a record-increasing 17th win of the season with victory in Sao Paulo ahead of Norris.There was a tense battle for the third spot on the podium with Fernando Alonso keeping Red Bull Sergio Perez at bay by just 0.053 seconds.Perez passed Alonso on Lap 70 but the former world champion took the place back on the final lap of the race as the pair made a thrilling dart to the line on the final straight. Lance Stroll finished fifth in the second Aston Martin ahead of Carlos Sainz of Ferrari.Seven-time champion Lewis Hamilton finished eighth for Mercedes.For Verstappen, it was his 52nd career win, lifting him one clear of four-time champion Alain Prost on the list of all-time winners.â€œIt was really good,â€ said Verstappen. â€œA well-executed race by the team, perfect pit-stops and well done I think. I had two good starts which was very important and then managed the tyres.â€ For Norris it was a seventh podium this year and 13th of his career, the most by any driver without recording a victory.â€œI couldnâ€™t have done any better,â€ Norris said. â€œP2 is as good as it gets nowadays. So, Iâ€™m happy with that. Max always had an answer.â€ Alonso held off Perez after the two swapped places twice in the closing laps. â€œIt was like 30 laps of pressure from Checo! When he passed me two laps from the end, I thought a podium was not possible and it was gone, but I got it back,â€ said the Spaniard.Brazilian Grand Prix result1) Max Verstappen, Red Bull2) Lando Norris, McLaren3) Fernando Alonso, Aston Martin4) Sergio Perez, Red Bull5) Lance Stroll, Aston Martin6) Carlos Sainz, Ferrari7) Pierre Gasly, Alpine8) Lewis Hamilton, MercedesMore CoverageFormula 1 stunned by wild 0.053sec robberyRicciardo loses his mind in fiery tirade9) Yuki Tsunoda, AlphaTauri10) Esteban Ocon, Alpineâ€” with AFPRead related topics:Daniel Ricciardo

caption: Witnesses have described the "horrifying" scene as the death count from a Victorian pub crash climbs. https://bit.ly/40nZLm4
article_title: â€˜Incorrectâ€™: Cop blasts rumour about pub deaths as details emerge
article_text: A top cop has blasted rumours about police being delayed in reaching the scene of a horror crash where five people were killed. Emergency services were called to Royal Hotel in Daylesford, north of Melbourne, after a white BMW X5 crashed into the busy venue and struck patrons just after 6pm on Sunday, killing five people and injuring several others.During a press conference on Monday, Victoria Police chief commissioner Shane Patton rejected reports that officers were delayed in reaching the scene or that members of the public were left banging on the door of the police station trying to get help. â€œThatâ€˜s totally incorrect,â€ he told reporters on Monday. â€œThe station was staffed, two police officers heard the collision and as I understand ran to the scene, itâ€™s a matter of a couple of 100 meters or so, and they were some of the first officers on the scene. â€œAnd they did exactly what theyâ€™re trained to do and weâ€™re very proud.â€Victorian Police address the media in relation to the major fatal car crash in Daylesford, Victoria. Picture: ABCA picnic table at the scene is filled with glasses still. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Brandan BeckettInvestigators at the scene on Monday. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Brandan BeckettAn investigator inspects an item at the scene on Monday. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Brandan BeckettPolice officers assess the carnage at the Royal Daylesford on Sunday night. . Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenThe pub was filled with hundreds of patrons in the hours before the crash due to the unofficial long weekend before Tuesdayâ€™s Melbourne Cup public holiday.The area, which also includes an ice-cream shop, was set up post-Covid with lots of tables and chairs.Images taken at the scene on Monday show the chaos that remains, with damaged picnic tables still covered in glasses and water jugs. Droves of community members, some tearful, attended the site of the incident to lay flowers through Monday morning. Several businesses adjacent to the scene made the decision to remain closed on Monday, despite the increased presence of visitors in the popular tourist town over the Melbourne Cup weekend. Jenna Acquarola and James Deriu attended the scene to lay flowers on Monday morning. â€œJust knowing that that happened... itâ€™s so sad for Daylesford,â€ Ms Acquarola said.â€œWe were here five minutes after it... and we saw it and it was just horrible.â€ Mr Deriu said bystanders who were first on the scene were visibly â€œtraumatisedâ€.â€œThey were beside themselves,â€ he said. Ms Acquarola said in the moments following the incident the area was flooded with police officers and bystanders rushing to help, while multiple white sheets had been laid over bodies on the road. â€œIt was a beautiful night, it was warm, the sun was going down,â€ she said of the busy area.â€œAnd it was instantly just destroyed.â€ The intersection around the crash site has remained taped off to the public.A general view from the scene of the crash. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Brandan BeckettSuperintendent John Fitzpatrick confirmed on Sunday night about 11pm four people had died at the scene â€“ two men and a woman and a six-year-old boy.A fifth, a teenage girl, later died in hospital. â€œI havenâ€™t seen anything this drastic for a long time,â€ he said.â€œAny time you have five people die at a particular scene, itâ€™s horrible.â€œThere are families that have got loved ones that are no longer going to be around.â€ â€œWe donâ€™t like to see anyone lose their life but to see a child â€“ you donâ€™t ever want to see anything like that.â€â€œThe car crashed into an area that has been set up really post-Covid with lots of tables and chairs, not just for the Royal Hotel, thereâ€™s an ice-cream shop there as well, so there (would have been) a lot of families. And it was a really warm night, and weâ€™ve got a long weekend â€¦ so it was pretty busy last night,â€ she told ABC Radio on Monday morning. â€œPeople have lost their lives, and their familiesâ€™ lives have changed forever. â€œIt will really have shocked a lot of people, and I think weâ€™re really only just be coming to terms with what happened today.â€Superintendent John Fitzpatrick confirmed that five people, including two children, had died in the crash. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenSuperintendent Fitzpatrick said the white BMW was travelling southwest down Albert St in the town when it mounted a kerb and drove through the beer garden.He said the driver of the car, a 66-year-old Mt Macedon man, was receiving treatment at Ballarat Hospital.â€œWe are waiting to speak to him,â€ he said. He said investigators were still trying to work out the cause of the tragedy.â€œItâ€™s a very complex scene,â€ he said.Superintendent Fitzpatrick said investigators were also still working to identify if any of the victims were related to one another. Crash reconstruction investigators were on scene Sunday night trying to determine the speed of the car, Superintendent Fitzpatrick said. He said the police would canvass the area for CCTV footage.Five people are dead and multiple people suffered serious injuries in the horror incident. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenHe said emergency services personnel would be offered counselling to help them process the â€œconfrontingâ€ scene. A woman from a business next to the Royal Daylesford told NCA NewsWire she and her staff saw some of the bodies on the pavement.â€œWeâ€™re all pretty shocked,â€ she said.â€œItâ€™s pretty bad, Iâ€™ve never seen anything so traumatic in my life.â€She said she had closed her business and would keep it closed on Monday.Another woman who watched the nightmare unfold described it as â€œhorrifyingâ€. â€œThere were bodies everywhere, it was horrifying,â€ she said.â€œI watched the whole crash. The car went up into the sky. I thought it was just dust. Itâ€™s only now I know it was bodies.â€ A police officer inspects a white BMX X5 close to the Royal Daylesford on Sunday evening. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenAn Ambulance Victoria spokesman said paramedics flew four patients to Melbourne for treatment, including one child. The child, a three-year-old boy, was flown to the Royal Childrenâ€™s Hospital in a serious condition.Two adults were flown to Royal Melbourne Hospital and one adult was flown to the Alfred Hospital, all with serious injuries. Air Ambulance Victoria sent four rescue helicopters to the scene to fly injured patients to hospitals. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenParamedics have also taken two patients to Ballarat and one patient to Royal Melbourne.The pub was busy with hundreds of patrons in the hours before the crash due to the unofficial long weekend before Tuesdayâ€™s Melbourne Cup public holiday. Debris and wreckage could be seen scattered around the crash zone.Jesse Leith, who owns a cafe and bar nearby on Vincent St, described the scene as horrific. He heard commotion in the street immediately after the crash.â€œThere was yelling and an eruption of noise in the street,â€ he said.Mr Leith closed his business early following the crash and said many others had done the same. He said the mood was sombre among the business owners and workers still on the street.Massive emergency resources were directed to the horror crash. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie Haydenâ€œWeâ€™ve been saying how no one remembers anything like this happening in Daylesford,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s a shock for a small town like this.â€The front of the BMW is crushed and the bumper is almost torn off. Another witness to the horror said she saw people sitting at tables in the sun just before the tragedy.â€œThey were having a wonderful time. Itâ€™s so sad to hear this,â€ she wrote online.Four Air Ambulance helicopters were deployed to the town fly critically injured people to hospital.â€œEmergency services are currently at the scene of a serious crash in Vincent St, Daylesford,â€ Victoria Police said.A car has crashed into Royal Hotel Beer Garden, Daylesford, killing multiple people. Picture: 7NewsEmergency services are on scene at the Royal Daylesford. Picture: SuppliedThe horror crash occurred around 6pm on Sunday: SuppliedDaylesford is about 100km northwest of Melbourne. Picture: Google Mapsâ€œAs emergency services need access to the scene we ask that members of the public avoid the area. Police are putting diversions in place.â€The Royal Hotel, located in the centre of town, was built in 1856 and has remained a popular venue for locals and visitors.It offers accommodation and indoor and outdoor dining. A worker at a nearby restaurant said the car involved was â€œmessed upâ€.â€œThere are a lot of people outside,â€ she said.Daylesford is a small town about 100km north west of Melbourne. Infrastructure Minister Catherine King, whose Ballarat electorate takes in Daylesford, has sent her condolences to those caught up in the tragedy.â€œMy thoughts are with all those at the scene, their friends and families and the broader Daylesford community,â€ she posted to X on Sunday evening. â€œPlease follow all the advice from emergency services as crews undertake their work.â€Hepburn Shire Mayor Brian Hood said the hotel was typically busy with patrons, particularly on a long weekend.â€œI can only imagine there would be a lot of people sitting out there. There are a lot of tables and chairs,â€ he said.A white BMW ploughed into patrons at the Royal Daylesford beer garden on Sunday evening. Several witnesses saw the horror unfold. Picture: NCA NewsWire / Josie HaydenMr Hood said he was unaware of any other crashes at that Vincent St roundabout.â€œIâ€™m not aware of any previous accidents there. There certainly hasnâ€™t been any recently,â€ he said.More CoverageTwo families caught up in pub crash tragedyMr Hood said the location was a busy intersection where drivers tended to slow down.â€œItâ€™s a very built-up area. All four entrances and exits into the roundabout are busy streets, and itâ€™s right in the middle of town,â€ he said.â€œTypically, people are travelling at very low speed when they approach it.â€

caption: LA Tourism CEO Adam Burke, who dished on the best â€œhidden gemsâ€ tourists need to know about. ðŸ‘€
article_title: â€™Incredibleâ€™ foodie find hidden behind grey door in Los Angeles
article_text: Behind a simple grey door next to a bridal shop Aussies can find some of the best food in Los Angeles.Thatâ€™s according to LA Tourism CEO Adam Burke, who dished on the best â€œhidden gemsâ€ tourists need to know about during a recent trip Down Under.Mr Burke, who lives in the popular US city, tells news.com.au he tries to dine at a new place once a week.â€œIn Mexico City thereâ€™s this restaurant called Cha Cha Cha,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s one of the most well-known restaurants in Mexico City. The same owners decided to open one up in LA.â€œRight in the Arts District, which is only about five minutes from Downtown, is LA Cha Cha Cha and what I love about it is itâ€™s so quintessentially LA because you think you may be in the wrong spot because you just see this grey door.â€LA Cha Cha Cha is hidden behind a grey door next to a bridal shop in the cityâ€™s Arts District. Picture: Googleâ€œOne side is a bridal boutique and the other side is a bar, and when you open the door you just see these stairs that go up,â€ he explained.â€œItâ€™s not until you reach the top of the stairs that you realise the entire top of the building has been transformed into the gorgeous rooftop garden, and in addition to having some of the most authentic Mexican food youâ€™ll ever have because itâ€™s the same recipes from Mexico City, they also have been cultivating mezcal flights.â€Mr Burke described it as â€œjust incredibleâ€.Behind the door and up stairs is a very popular Mexican restaurant. Picture: SuppliedLA Tourism CEO Adam Burke said the restaurant uses the same recipes as its Mexico City restaurant. Picture: SuppliedMr Burkeâ€™s second tip for Aussie foodies is to check out chef Niki Nakayamaâ€™s second â€œlesser knownâ€ Japanese restaurant, n/soto.Ms Nakayama is best known for her two Michelin star restaurant n/naka.â€œItâ€™s easier to get into, itâ€™s a little bit less pricey and itâ€™s amazing food so you can have a Michelin two star experience but at this hidden gem called n/soto,â€ Mr Burke said.He described Ms Nakayama as â€œan amazing chefâ€ who is â€œvery much a global up-and-coming starâ€.The chef behind two Michelin star restaurant n/naka also has a lesser known restaurant called n/soto. Picture: Wonho PhotoMr Burke said Niki Nakayama was a â€œglobal up-and-coming starâ€. Picture: Wonho PhotoSticking with the Japanese theme, Mr Burke said another LA spot Aussies must know about if they are after relaxation is Suiho-En, also known as The Japanese Garden.â€œItâ€™s actually not one garden, itâ€™s three and itâ€™s designed by a gentleman [Dr Koichi Kawana] who is revered in Japan as being one of the pre-eminent landscape architects,â€ he said.â€œHe does these incredible gardens in Japan so he designed three Japanese gardens over acres in the San Fernando Valley and itâ€™s just gorgeous.â€Suiho-En, also known as The Japanese Garden, in San Fernando Valley. Picture: SuppliedThe 2.6 hectare authentic Japanese garden includes a dry Zen meditation garden, a â€œwet-strollingâ€ garden and a tea garden.Travellers can check the Suiho-En website for events and workshops involving music and meditation.As for new sights that should be on Aussie travellersâ€™ radar, Mr Burke said South Los Angeles was â€œhaving a total renaissance right nowâ€ with the neighbourhood of Crenshaw being â€œone to watchâ€.Destination Crenshaw will open early next year, which is a 2.1km outdoor gallery along historic Crenshaw Boulevard.2.1km of art and culture celebrating Black Los Angeles will open in Crenshaw next year. Picture: Destination CrenshawMore CoverageInsane Aussie bar ranked best in worldSurprise Aussie dish taking over New Yorkâ€œItâ€™s going to be the largest public art installation in the United States devoted to Black culture and art, but itâ€™s also going to be one of the largest public art installations in the country period,â€ Mr Burke said.â€œItâ€™s everything from the real luminaries in the Black and African arts, including the gentleman [Kehinde Wiley] who painted president Barack Obamaâ€™s official portrait, all the way to these local street muralists.â€The public art exhibition will be open year round, and Mr Burke expects it to â€œgain more and more notorietyâ€.

caption: â€œYouâ€™re noting that the view of you is pretty grim, so you come away thinking, I am pretty grim, Iâ€™m a bit of a failure on that front â€“ and people are writing that." Full story: https://bit.ly/3skEEVj
article_title: Liz Hayes opens up about â€˜soul destroyingâ€™ attention on her three divorces
article_text: Veteran Australian TV journalist Liz Hayes has always preferred to keep her private life just that â€“ but it became increasingly difficult during a decade-long period in which she divorced three times. Hayes, 67, opens up about that tumultuous time in her life in a podcast interview to accompany her feature in the latest issue of Stellar magazine, out today. Hayes had married her first husband Brian, a builder in her hometown of Taree, in the late 70s when she was 21 years old. They split in the mid-80s, around the time she was appointed co-host of the Today show and her career and public profile skyrocketed.Then came a brief marriage in February 1991, to Australian entrepreneur John Singleton. They split by Christmas of that year, Hayes becoming the fourth of his six wives, and remained friends. With second husband John Singleton in 1991.With third husband, Dr Stephen Coogan.In 1994 came another marriage, to Sydney doctor Stephen Coogan â€“ but they split in 1997. With three divorces under her belt at the age of 40, the journo whoâ€™d always cherished her privacy found herself becoming the story, with speculation about her rocky love life in tabloids and womenâ€™s weekly mags in the late 90s.â€œIt was a crap time. Letâ€™s face it, these things are not great. And itâ€™s magnified. It becomes bigger than Ben Hur,â€ Hayes told Stellar. â€œYouâ€™re looking at yourself. Youâ€™re reading about yourself. Youâ€™re noting that the view of you is pretty grim, so you come away thinking, I am pretty grim, Iâ€™m a bit of a failure on that front â€“ and people are writing that,â€ she said. She confessed it felt â€œsoul destroyingâ€ to see the attention her string of failed marriages had garnered. Hayes described the attention around her failed marriages as â€œsoul destroying.â€ Picture: Don Arnoldâ€œYou could go knock on everybodyâ€™s door and say, â€˜Well, can I give you a bit of backstory?â€™ You canâ€™t do that, so you just have to accept that thatâ€™s the deal. But frankly, itâ€™s a bit soul destroying to have seemingly the world telling you, â€˜Yep, youâ€™re a dud.â€™ More CoverageLiz Hayes, 67, looks decades younger at eventâ€˜Undo your braâ€™: Brandâ€™s â€˜creepyâ€™ Aussie actâ€œItâ€™s hard. I defy anybody, and those people who write those stories, to sit there and hear and see that written about them.â€Since that time, Hayes love life has settled down considerably: Former 60 Minutes soundman Ben Crane has been Hayesâ€™ partner since the early 2000s. The fiercely private pair are rarely seen together in public. Read the full interview with Hayes in Stellar Magazine, free with the Sunday Herald Sun and Sunday Telegraph, out today.

caption: COMMENT: The public canâ€™t get enough of one thing from Meghan Markle â€“ but the wild uptick in demand isnâ€™t helping her popularity.
article_title: Meghan Markleâ€™s Suits breaks Netflix records as her popularity plummets
article_text: COMMENTThey might make an unlikely pair but this week, both Queen Camilla and Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, have been notching up royal firsts. (And somewhere up above, Queen Mary suddenly feels faint.)Camilla has become the first Queen in British history to have started her Christmas shopping while on an official State Tour, going on such a spree at a craft market at a donkey sanctuary in Nairobi her aides ran out of cash and had to dash around issuing IOUs. And Meghan? This week her TV alma mater Suits broke all records and hit its 14th week as the most streamed TV show in the world. It has broken so much streaming ground they are probably running out of spades. And while I would very much like to spend the next thousand words of this story examining in minute detail just who might be getting what from Her Majestyâ€™s donkey bender come December 24 (maybe the sisal bag she bought was for Prince Andrew to carry around all his lawyersâ€™ bills?) itâ€™s the Meghan milestone that demands a closer look. Because two things are happening right now and they donâ€™t quite gel. Meghan Markle as Rachel Zane in Suits/ Picture: Ian Watson/USA Network/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty ImagesOn one hand, Suits, the cable dramedy bought by Netflix earlier this year has, out of the blue, been attracting stratospheric viewing numbers. For example, in one week in August alone, it was watched for 3.9 billion minutes â€“ thatâ€™s 65 million hours. Holy hell. The legal procedural is at least the second, and by now might be the first, most-streamed series ever recorded by Nielsen. (Based on numbers over consecutive weeks.) And yet on the other hand, Meghan and her husband Prince Harry, the Duke of Sussex seem stuck in the doldrumest of career doldrums.How come Suits is sailing past milestones and view counts like a TV steamroller yet the Sussexesâ€™ stock remains decidedly lukewarm? When Suits first aired back in 2011, it did moderately well, with an average of 4.28 million people tuning in per episode. However, by the time season seven debuted, the final one to star a certain actress who was by then busy across the ocean having a tiara fitted, that number had fallen to 1.3 million. Meghan Markle and Patrick J. Adams in Suits. Picture: Shane Mahood/USA NetworkIn the Suits season five finale, Meghan Markle's character Rachel Zane in a wedding dress.Star Patrick J. Adams got a 2012 SAG Awards nomination but otherwise the series was entirely blanked by the more prestigious gong shows like the Emmys and the Golden Globes. Still, while the show had an undeniable and considerable fanbase, we are not talking about a series that reinvented the genre or set the entertainment world on fire. Then earlier this year Netflix, which also happens to have Harry & Meghan on their books, threw down some cash and bought the rights to stream Suits. KABOOM. (The show was previously, and still is, available on the US streaming channel Peacock). Soon after landing on the platform, the show started topping the weekly Nielsen chart of most streamed content, leaving much more recent or big budget shows in its pinstriped wake. If you had asked me back then what the consequences of Suitsâ€™ resurgence would be for Meghan, I would have called it a gift that would keep on giving (like Andrewâ€™s sisal bag). I would have made the case that the duchessâ€™s face suddenly appearing in millions of lounge rooms and showing her as the savvy, driven Rachel Zane would have seen a corresponding bounce in her popularity and professional prospects. I would have assumed we were looking at the sort of comeback scenario that would have had Netflix execs rubbing their hands with glee (and finding their duchess some new documentary projects, quick sticks) and royal courtiers stocking up on Dramamine. Ultimately, I would have made the case that for Meghan, after years of being best known for taking aim at the royal family, this yearâ€™s success of Suits would have served as something of a restart button. Here would be a chance for audiences to see the duchess in a whole new light (or reminded of an old light)! To give her a fresh injection of cultural currency and to reorient her celebrity!Except, nope. Sorry. No dice. This yearâ€™s success of Suits should have served as something of a restart button, but sorry, no dice. Picture: Shane Mahood/USA Network/NBCU Photo Bank/NBCUniversal via Getty ImagesIf there was some way to include a graph here, a technical question Iâ€™ve never pondered before, what we would see is the Suits line tracking energetically skywards while Meghanâ€™s popularity slipped. In the second quarter (April, May and June), 40 per cent of Americans polled by YouGov (and reported by Newsweek) liked the Duchess of Sussex and 23 per cent disliked, putting her on an overall position of +17. However, for the months of July, August and September, the very same time that the legal series was enchanting viewers with its heavy reliance on pencil skirts and office banter, Meghanâ€™s popularity was going the other direction. During this time, Americans who had a positive view of her had fallen to 32 per cent while those with an unfavourable view remained nearly the same at 22 per cent, thus putting her on +10 overall. (Another YouGov/Newsweek twofer.)Camilla Christmas shopping at the markets in Nairobi, Kenya. Picture: Ben Stansall â€“ Pool/Getty ImagesMeghanâ€™s career remains as underwhelming as Camillaâ€™s grandchildren will feel receiving their gifts on Christmas Day. Picture: Bryan Bedder/Getty Images for Project Healthy MindsItâ€™s only fair at this juncture to point out that this yearâ€™s Suits Netflix rocket ship has not, so far, particularly helped any of the other cast members or seen any of them enjoy any sort of career revivification. The â€˜butâ€™ here is that none of them married a prince and had a wedding watched by nearly two billion people. The incongruity that I find fascinating is that while, over the last few months, much of the world has fallen hook, line and clicker for Adamsâ€™ Mike Ross, including his romance with Meghanâ€™s Zane, the Sussexesâ€™ careers remain about as underwhelming as Camillaâ€™s grandchildren will feel on Christmas Day when they discover they have gotten Â£5 WH Smith vouchers. Again. More CoverageHarry, Meghanâ€™s rare outing with their kidsUS company distances itself from MeghanDespite the Sussexes landing on US soil in 2020 as the most sizzling of hot property since the advent of the Furby, somehow they have snatched mediocrity out of the jaws of success. Where will or should the Sussexes go from here? I have no idea. If only there was a crack team of bright minds with law degrees and razor sharp wits to take on this particular case. Daniela Elser is a writer, editor and a royal commentator with more than 15 yearsâ€™ experience working with a number of Australiaâ€™s leading media titles. Read related topics:Meghan MarkleNetflix

caption: Congratulations! â¤ï¸ Full story: https://bit.ly/49pVqmw
article_title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker welcome first baby together
article_text: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker have reportedly welcomed their first child together. Kardashian gave birth to her fourth child, a baby boy, within the last few days, sources told People and TMZ. The 44-year-old and the 47-year-old Blink-182 drummer are yet to confirm the news.The couple, who wed in 2022, announced they were expecting their first child together at a Blink-182 concert in June.Kardashian held up a cardboard sign among the crowd reading â€œTravis Iâ€™m Pregnantâ€, in a nod to a scene from the music video of the bandâ€™s 1999 smash hit, All The Small Things.The pair later told the world they were expecting a boy at a sex reveal party that month. Earlier this week, Barker let slip the pair are due for a â€œHalloween babyâ€, who he referred to as â€˜Rockyâ€™.â€œThere was a benefit in Hawaii that we [Blink-182] were gonna do, but itâ€™s the week that Rockyâ€™s due,â€ Barker said on the One Life One Chance podcast.Podcast host Toby Morse complimented the name, made famous by Sylvester Stalloneâ€™s legendary Rocky franchise, to which Barker responded: â€œHeâ€™s gonna come out of my wifeâ€™s vagina like doing front kicks and push-ups.â€Itâ€™s unclear if â€˜Rockyâ€™ is just a placeholder name during Kardashianâ€™s pregnancy.Kardashian earlier revealed she suffered a health scare after she was rushed to hospital in September.She later thanked the â€œincredible doctors for saving our babyâ€™s lifeâ€ in a post on Instagram. More CoverageTravis Barker lets slip name for baby boyStar to pay younger girlfriend $46k a monthâ€œI am eternally grateful to my husband who rushed to my side from tour to be with me in the hospital and take care of me afterwards, my rock. And to my mum, thank you for holding my hand through this,â€ she wrote.Kardashian already shares sons Reign, eight, and Mason, 13, as well as daughter Penelope, 11, with her ex Scott Disick.Barker has two children with ex-wife Shanna Moakler, Landon, 19, and Alabama, 17. He also raised Moaklerâ€™s daughter from another relationship, Atiana De La Hoya, 24.

caption: It's called 'going troppo', and the two words perfectly sum up the territory madness.
article_title: â€˜Going troppoâ€™: The most Aussie thing that happens in the NT
article_text: Welcome to Ask Doctor Zac, a weekly column from news.com.au. This week Dr Zac Turner shares how to avoid going â€˜troppoâ€™ on a budget.QUESTION: Hi Dr Zac, I live in Darwin, and itâ€™s the time of year when it gets so hot people turn troppo! I always try to stay hydrated by using hydration tablets but they are so expensive these days. Do you know any cheap alternatives I can use to keep myself sane? â€“ Will, 25, Darwin ANSWER: For those readers who donâ€™t know what Will is talking about â€“ in Northern Australia thereâ€™s a term for when people turn crazy from the heat and humidity: going troppo. Itâ€™s a manifestation of a few symptoms like hysteria, stress and crankiness that comes from dehydration and tropical heat stress. Itâ€™s a real thing, and certainly one to avoid. Every summer those in Darwin fear â€˜going troppoâ€™ from the heat. Picture: iStockAthletes need to be especially careful to keep hydrated and their electrolytes balanced. Just like a car engine can explode if thereâ€™s not enough coolant, our muscles can literally melt â€“ a condition called rhabdomyolysis. There certainly are cheaper alternatives to hydration tablets, but first letâ€™s look into why humans need water to survive. Water is vital for many body functions. About half our blood is â€œblood plasmaâ€, which is over 90 per cent water. Blood plasma is essential for carrying energy, nutrients and oxygen to the cells in the body that need it most. Water helps to remove waste products via the kidneys. It also helps to keep joints lubricated, the digestive system functioning, the bodyâ€™s temperature controlled and skin plump and strong. There are also these things called principal electrolytes: sodium, potassium, calcium, phosphorus, bicarbonate and chloride. These are minerals that conduct an electrical charge when mixed with water, hence the name electrolytes.
